subject: WSDS Springs into Success
preview:
Hello everyone, welcome back to another week of WSDS! We had a busy weekend with both speech and debate representing Wisconsin well at competitions.




Open the Sample Gates


One of the two asynchronous tournaments that speech competed in wa
body_html:
Hello everyone, welcome back to another week of WSDS! We had a busy weekend with both speech and debate representing Wisconsin well at competitions.




Open the Sample Gates


One of the two asynchronous tournaments that speech competed in was the Open the Sample Gates tournament. Congratulations to Lily Smogor for her excellent performance, placing 2nd in Impromptu Speaking and 5th in Informational Speaking!!



Lucky 7


We also competed in the Lucky 7 asynchronous tournament. Congratulations to Izzy for placing 3rd in Communication Analysis!!



ANU Spring


Debate traveled virtually to Australia for the ANU Spring tournament. We competed overnight, facing excellent competition during the tournament and learned a lot! 


Badgerland HS 


Some team members, old and new, helped out at the high school Badgerland tournament with some judging. Thank you to all those who helped out.



Register to Drive to Tournaments 


We need drivers to make sure we can send as many people to future in-person tournaments as possible! If you have a U.S. driver's license (especially if you’re from Wisconsin), please go through the steps on this Google Doc to get authorized to drive UW vehicles. The sooner you start this process the better–your state’s DMV might be slow, and we need drivers as soon as possible! Let Austin know if you have major issues with getting authorized. 



See you soon and have a great week! :)



Stay connected! 

Instagram 

Facebook

WIN 

Discord 



Have Questions? Email Us: 


President: Izzy Parker, ibparker@wisc.edu

Vice President: Emily Lawrence, eplawrence@wisc.edu

Treasurer: Dheeraj Pasikanti, pasikanti@wisc.edu

Corresponding Secretary: Lucy Dreyer, ldreyer2@wisc.edu

Events Coordinator: Heba Haq, hhaq@wisc.edu

Coach: Austin Thoma, austin.thoma@wisc.edu


--
You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "Wisconsin Speech and Debate" group.
To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to speechanddebate+unsubscribe@g-groups.wisc.edu.
To view this discussion visit https://groups.google.com/a/g-groups.wisc.edu/d/msgid/speechanddebate/90276287-ed58-4284-ab7c-98a184ca93d3n%40g-groups.wisc.edu.

Adjusted hours, house music, and more! ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Thanksgiving Recess Adjusted Hours 🦃

Active Badgers, we are so grateful for all of you. In observation of the upcoming holiday, we will have adjusted hours for the following dates. Enjoy the break and have a safe week! Standard operating hours will resume on December 1!

 
 

The Nick

November 26
6am - 6:30pm

November 26
6am - 6:30pm

November 26

7:45am - 9pm

 
HOURS & SCHEDULES
 
 
 

Men's Mental Health Month 🧘‍♂️

Approximately 31% of college-aged men report that they have experienced depression. In support of Men’s Mental Health Month in November, UHS Mental Health Services is teaming up to create spaces where men feel heard and free of judgment.

Join us on November 19 for Barbershop Talks, engage in informal conversation surrounding mental health, and get a free haircut.

You matter and deserve to feel heard! Find more information on the event at the link below. 

LEARN MORE
 
 
 

Lace Your Skates 🧊

 
 
 

DJ Sub-Zero is on the decks 🎧

Deep in your John Summit phase? Perfect. Join us on Saturday, November 22 from 7:30 – 9pm for a Holiday music-themed skate night! If you come to skate in a holiday themed sweater, you get to skate for free!

MORE INFO
 
 
 
 

Winter Break Hours ⏰

With winter break around the corner, we want to highlight that ice rink our hours and events may differ!

For the most updated information, check our rink schedules on our website!

ICE RINK HOURS
 
 
 
 

Price Drop 🤑

Fall skate passes have dropped to half price! Enjoy a discounted rate of $25 from now until the end of the semester. Purchase a skate pass on our website or talk to the Ice Rink staff if you have any questions! 

GET SKATING
 
 
 

Prioritize your Wellbeing 🫶

 
 

Is the mid-semester slump getting to you? We offer multiple wellbeing-centered services to fit your needs: including massages, guided meditations, wellbeing workshops, and one-on-one wellness coaching. 

Save the date for our last wellbeing workshop of the semester, the Wellbeing Study Cafe! Join us on Tuesday, December 9 from 6 - 8pm and enjoy coffee, tea, hot chocolate, and snacks while preparing for finals. We'll also provide Esports, coloring, beading, board games, and puzzles. First 30 attendees get a free Portillo's sandwich card!

SIGN UP
 
 
 
 
 
 

Did Someone Say Aqua Zumba? 🕺

 
 

Calling all night owls! Join us at the Cove Pool for Late Night Aqua Zumba, sponsored by Ian’s Pizza. Integrating dance and exercise, moving to international beats in shallow water. Come make a splash, feel the music, and join the fun! No dance experience required. Participants must be comfortable in shallow water (~4ft).

Arrive 10 minutes early to claim your spot; no late entry. Bring your Wiscard, water bottle, and a towel. Participants will receive an Ian’s Slice card, while supplies last. Join us on the following dates: 

  • Wednesday, December 3
  • Thursday, December 11

Time: 9 - 9:45pm
Location: Cove Pool at Bakke
Cost: FREE to UW Madison Students & Rec Well Members!

 
MORE INFO
 
 
 

Get Your Train On 🏋️

 
 
 

Personal training is looking for clients!  Our nationally-certified trainers work with you to create workouts that reflect your interests and goals, regardless of whether you’re training for performance or just starting out.

SIGN UP NOW!
 
 
 
 

Last call for fitness equipment orientation! Participants will meet one-on-one with a personal trainer. In the 30 minute session, you will learn correct technique on machines, and learn the muscles being worked on each machine. 

Nick: Thursday, November 20 at 6pm

Bakke: Thursday, November 20 at 5pm

LEARN MORE
 
 
 

360 Classes 🏋️

 
 

The Perfect way to try a new fitness style 🥊

Looking for an exciting new workout? Check out our 360 classes ⬇️

  • Cardio 360: A high-intensity class that integrates running, rowing, biking, and skiing using cardio equipment, paired with strength exercises during active recoveries.
  • Strike 360: A high-intensity workout, where a coach will lead you through explosive boxing combinations on the heavy bags paired with power, strength, and agility exercises. 
  • Train 360: Enhance your power, strength, and endurance with this circuit-based, high-intensity training class. 
TELL ME MORE
 
 

What's Happening at Rec Well? 🤗

 
 

Tennis Time 🎾

Mark your calendars! Our last NTS Student Night of the semester is on Friday, November 21 from 6 - 9pm. Enjoy unlimited play for just $5 and free Papa John's pizza! 

ALL THINGS TENNIS
 
 
 
 

FREE FOOD! 🧑‍🍳

Join us on Wednesday, December 3 from 5:30 - 7pm for our Cozy Sweets open house. Enjoy heartwarming classics away from the winter chill at the Wolf Teaching Kitchen, all at no cost!

NUTRITION EDUCATION
 
 
 
 

Upcoming Tournaments ⛳

We have Long Drive and Just Dance Tournaments happening on December 6. Get registered to either swing or dance your way to a champ shirt!

REGISTER HERE
 
 
 

Thoughts on Rec Well? 🤔

 
 

We want to hear from you 🫵

Have some feedback or suggestions for us? Submit this feedback survey that goes directly to professional staff who manage Rec Well programs and services. 

FEEDBACK SURVEY
 
 
 
 
 
 

If you need an accommodation, email accommodations@recwell.wisc.edu. All accommodation requests should be made two weeks in advance. We will attempt to fulfill requests made after this date but cannot guarantee they will be met.

 
 

We move Badgers to play hard, get fit, and live well. Rec Well is part of Student Affairs at UW-Madison.

Preferences  |  Unsubscribe

Purchase a fall skate pass at a discounted rate of $25.
Register for the Long Drive Tournament.
Register for the Just Dance Tournament.
Submit the feedback survey for Rec Well programs and services.

subject: 📍 Find a career services office
preview:
It's never too early or too late!
View Online Version

Badgers,

With papers, exams, laundry, and everything else on your plate, it’s easy to put off thinking about your future. But preparing for what’s next is a big part of why you’re here—and UW–Ma
body_html:
It's never too early or too late!
View Online Version
Badgers,

With papers, exams, laundry, and everything else on your plate, it’s easy to put off thinking about your future. But preparing for what’s next is a big part of why you’re here—and UW–Madison has tools to help.

Put “career planning” at the top of your to-do list with support from Career Services. 
 
Find a Career Services Office
 
At UW–Madison, there’s a career services office for every student. Through a career services office you can:

  • 🤝 Meet with a career advisor
  • 💼 Get help searching for jobs and internships 
  • 📚 Discuss graduate school options
  • 👋 Join events like alumni panels, resume workshops, and career fairs
Types of career services offices

Each school and college at UW–Madison has its own career services office. You’ll also find offices focused on specific goals—like preparing for medical or law careers, or finding international internships.

Not sure what career path is for you? There’s even a career services office to help you explore your options and decide your next steps. 
 
 
Find a Career Services Office
 
It’s never too early OR too late to get connected!

Move it to the top of your to-do list, and let’s launch your career together.

Career Services at UW–Madison
info@careers.wisc.edu
 
The Office of Academic & Career Success  |  Privacy Policy  |   Unsubscribe
 
108 Ingraham Hall, 1155 Observatory Drive, Madison, WI 53706

todos.content: Put career planning at the top of your to-do list and find a Career Services Office at UW–Madison for support.

Get Outlook for iOS
From: Evan Weilun Liu <eliu59@wisc.edu>

To: Sandra Bradley <sandra.bradley@wisc.edu>
Subject: Re: UW Match--Mentor Support and Connection
 
Hi Sandra, I have provided a short introduction for my project and the things that I need the most help with. Could you help me forward this email to your CS faculty connections or the industry connections? I would greatly appreciate it!

Best Regard,
Evan Liu

From: Evan Weilun Liu <eliu59@wisc.edu>
Date: Monday, November 10, 2025 at 17:41
To: Sandra Bradley <sandra.bradley@wisc.edu>
Subject: UW Match--Mentor Support and Connection

Hi, my name is Evan,
Currently, I’m working on this project UW Match, the website can be found in uwmatch.com. The goal for this project is to design a student-centered course planning app. In this app, students can find all kinds of course information in one place, they can also plan courses and validate their major requirements. We have developed a lot of useful features for this app. Students can easily upload their degree plan PDF to load their courses, when they plan their courses, the major requirements progress is updated in real time for all majors the user has chosen. We scraped course information from several places, and provide features like checking grades distribution, RateMyProfessors, course sections and instructors, and more. The final goal for this project is to be the go-to place for students to plan courses, as it provides an all-in-one solution that actually solves the students’ needs.

I’m not the most experienced in terms of organizing a large codebase with ongoing new features and refining. Therefore, I often encountered a lot of problems as I’m developing this project to make it better for everyone. If possible, I would like to have a mentor that I could consult with to help with organizing the codebase, frontend design, API design, data models, data analytics as well as how to create algorithms for a scheduler tool, course recommendations and more.

Thank you!
Evan Liu

todos.content: Check for advisor confirmation form from SOLI regarding Bucky Match.
Forward the UW Match project introduction email to CS faculty and industry connections.

subject: StartingBlock Wins $75,000 from SBA to Advance Entrepreneurship in Wisconsin
preview:
StartingBlock Madison, the region's leading entrepreneurship hub, announced today it has been selected as a 2025 recipient of the U.S. Small Business Administration's Growth Accelerator Fund Competition, receiving $75,000 to expand entrepreneurial


Ev
body_html:
StartingBlock Madison, the region's leading entrepreneurship hub, announced today it has been selected as a 2025 recipient of the U.S. Small Business Administration's Growth Accelerator Fund Competition, receiving $75,000 to expand entrepreneurial

Evan,

 

I'm excited to share news that reinforces the strength and momentum of Madison's entrepreneurial ecosystem: StartingBlock Madison has been selected as a 2025 recipient of the U.S. Small Business Administration's Growth Accelerator Fund Competition, receiving $75,000 to expand our support for entrepreneurs across south central Wisconsin.

 

National Recognition for Regional Impact

This marks our second SBA Growth Accelerator award, following our 2023 win. Being selected from a competitive national field - just 76 organizations were chosen - validates both the quality of our programming and the strength of the ecosystem partnerships we've built together.

 

As I reflect on this recognition, I can't help but think about what it represents: federal acknowledgment that south central Wisconsin is building something special. We are thrilled that our federal partners understand and value the work that StartingBlock is doing in the Madison ecosystem. We are looking forward to partnering with regional government, industry and university partners to further entrepreneurship in south central Wisconsin.

 

Building on Proven Success

This award comes as we build on strong performance metrics from our 2024-2025 WEDC Entrepreneurial Partnership Grant, where we served 85 entrepreneurs.

 

The $75,000 will enable us to enhance support for entrepreneurs across key regional sectors - advanced manufacturing, agricultural technology, clean energy, health technology, and information technology - while serving businesses at every stage from concept validation through scaling.

 

An Invitation to Partner

This momentum creates exciting opportunities for collaboration. As we expand our programming and pursue additional funding opportunities we're seeking partners who share our vision of establishing south central Wisconsin as a nationally recognized innovation hub.

 

Whether you're interested in providing mentorship, exploring pilot projects with emerging companies, connecting students to real-world entrepreneurship, or simply learning more about what we're building together, I'd welcome the conversation.

 

Let's Connect

Visit startingblockmadison.org to learn more about our programming and partnership opportunities, or reach out directly. I'm always happy to discuss how we can work together to strengthen our regional entrepreneurial ecosystem.

 

Thank you for your continued support of entrepreneurship in south central Wisconsin. Recognition like this belongs to all of us who are committed to working together to build a thriving innovation economy.

 

Best regards,

 

Scott

--

Scott Mosley CEO, StartingBlock Madison

scottmosley@startingblockmadison.org

StartingBlock - Madison's Startup Hub, 821 E Washington, Suite 200, Madison, WI 53703, USA, 608.467.4949

Unsubscribe Manage preferences

todos.content: Visit startingblockmadison.org to learn more about programming and partnership opportunities
Reach out directly to Scott Mosley to discuss working together to strengthen the regional entrepreneurial ecosystem

View this email in your browser

GMM #4 Recap!

Thank you for attending our fourth and last General Member Meeting of the fall semester! We had the pleasure of hearing from Rotary Global Grant Scholar Reika Yoshida! A recap of her inspirational experiences is below as well as important reminders and upcoming events!

 

This meeting, we had the pleasure of hearing from Rotary Global Grant Scholar Reika Yoshida! A current UW–Madison master’s student in Educational Leadership and Policy Analysis, Reika shared how studying abroad transformed her academically, professionally, and personally. She emphasized stepping outside your comfort zone, adapting to new academic and cultural environments, and embracing challenges such as language barriers, critical thinking expectations, and finding belonging. Reika highlighted how global experiences build valuable skills, expand opportunities, and align with Rotary’s mission to promote equity, education, and community impact worldwide.

Her advice: stay curious, tell your story proudly, build connections, and believe in your ability to create meaningful change!

 

Upcoming Events!

Social #3: Trivia at the Sett!

Our third social of the year will be trivia hosted by the Sett at Union South! The event is on November 19th, @5-7pm, please arrive a few minutes before!

Volunteer Event: Adopt-A-Block!

Our last Adopt-A-Block is on Sunday, November 23rd  @11-12pm at Grainger Hall. Sign ups are FULL! If you are signed up, keep an eye out for text reminders!!

Professional Development Event: Rotaract-UW Networking Roundtable!

Rotaract-UW is excited to host a networking roundtable on Wednesday, December 3rd @6-7 pm, Rm 2180 in Grainger Hall! You’ll have the opportunity to network and learn new things from ~5 professionals!



Mark your calendars!! GMM #5 is on Monday, February 2nd, 2026!!

 


Join our GroupMe for more information and updates!

Important Reminders

Membership Points System:

Our membership works on a 3-2-1 points system, where you need to attend 3 GMMs, 2 volunteer events, and 1 social per semester. You can earn 1 flex point per semester by attending an extra event which can be used in another category for membership.

 

Connect with us on LinkedIn!

We have our LinkedIn up and running! Go connect with our LinkedIn page for reminders of events, recaps, and all things Rotaract UW!


Click Here and connect with us on LinkedIn!


 

For any questions or concerns please email:

Camber Walvoort

President

cwalvoort@wisc.edu

Adam Hahn

Vice-President

achahn3@wisc.edu

Paige Hoffman

Service Co-Chair

pehoffman2@wisc.edu

Work Smart(er) This Year

You have a plan for your future. Stay on track with your goals with the help of online courses from UW Independent Learning–courses you can begin anytime and that count for University of W
body_html:
Register now and start right away

Work Smart(er) This Year

You have a plan for your future. Stay on track with your goals with the help of online courses from UW Independent Learning–courses you can begin anytime and that count for University of Wisconsin undergraduate credit.

We offer courses that are:


  • Open Enrollment: No worrying about wait lists
  • Flexible. No waiting for next semester. Register and begin when you’re ready.
  • High quality and transferable
  • 100% online in essential subject areas

Talk to your adviser and check Transferology to see how UW Independent Learning can work for you. 


Courses are offered in partnership with UW-Eau Claire, UW-Green Bay, UW-Oshkosh, UW-Parkside, UW-Superior and UW-Whitewater.

Have questions? Get in touch with us at il@uwex.wisconsin.edu.

Universities of Wisconsin Independent Learning | 780 Regent Street | Madison, WI 53715 US

subject: How to Survive a Wisconsin Winter! ☃️
preview:
The tips you wish you would've got as a freshman...






How to Survive a Wisconsin Winter

As the weather cools off and the days get shorter, you may be starting to dread another long Wisconsin winter. Or maybe this winter is your first and you
body_html:
The tips you wish you would've got as a freshman...
How to Survive a Wisconsin Winter

As the weather cools off and the days get shorter, you may be starting to dread another long Wisconsin winter. Or maybe this winter is your first and you're not sure what to expect. Whether you're an experienced pro or an unprepared out-of-stater, this guide will help you survive (and maybe even enjoy) this upcoming season.

Get the Proper Gear 
When it comes to winter, staying warm should be your top priority.  If you're new here, you will soon realize (if you haven't already) that a light jacket or sweatshirt is no match for a Wisconsin winter.  A good winter coat is essential on this campus. If you're looking to invest in a high quality jacket that will last  most, if not all of your time at UW-Madison, the Madison REI is a great place to start. REI sells brands like The North Face, Patagonia, Arc'teryx, Columbia and Obermeyer, all of which are great options to keep you warm this winter. If you would rather shop from home, there are plenty of options online. For a more budget friendly choice check out Sierra, an outdoor gear store in Madison with lower prices.

Unfortunately, just a jacket is not enough to get you through this winter season. Winter boots are a must. REI and Sierra are also great places to look locally and brands such as Sorel, Merrell, The North Face, Columbia and Bogs are all reliable options. 

Lastly, don't forget the accessories. A hat, scarf and gloves or mittens will make a huge difference. If you want to show off your Badger pride, the University Bookstore  has plenty of choices. Winter can quickly become boring and having fun with your accessories can make these dull months more enjoyable. And finally, if you tend to run cold, buy a pack of hand warmers from Amazon. They're perfect for those long walks to class or freezing football games.

Winter Clothes Are Expensive …
There's no question that the proper winter gear comes at a cost, but staying warm is essential for everyone. For more affordable winter gear check out these options and resources:

  • WayForward's Clothing Center: WayForward is a local organization that helps provide necessities to those living in Dane County. Their clothing center offers free in-season clothing with a wide range of sizes. 

  • Thrift Stores: Thrifting is a great option to reduce costs. The Madison Goodwill is an excellent place to look and there are a few thrift stores on State Street that are good ideas to check out too. 

  • Basic Needs Request: UW-Madison students can request basic needs such as winter gear, clothing, school supplies and more through Purposity, an organization the university partners with to help students in need. To learn more or request an item, visit their website. 

  • The Office of Student Assistance and Support: This office helps students navigate all kinds of issues. If you're struggling to afford proper winter gear, this would be a great resource to utilize.

Know the Bus Routes 
Walking far in the winter can be rough, but luckily UW-Madison has a great bus system which can make your trek to class a bit easier.  If you're new to using the bus, it might seem intimidating. But once you know the basics you'll be set.  Here's what you need to know:

  • Campus Buses: The UW campus bus routes are free for all students, employees, faculty members and visitors. For easy remembering, the campus routes all start with the number eight: 80, 81, 82 and 84. Buses stop at the blue campus bus signs. In general, look for stops near dorms, libraries, unions and common areas for students. For more information on campus bus routes, visit UW-Madison's Transportation website.  

  • Off Campus Buses: If you are looking to go off campus, you will use Madison Metro Transit. In order to ride, you will need to obtain a bus pass. Click here for more information on how to get a pass. You can also see and plan your trips on all bus routes via Apple and Google Maps. 

Keeping Up Motivation 
As the days get shorter and the sky turns grayer, it's easy to lose motivation. Here are a few tips to help you stay productive: 

  • Stay Active: Staying active will improve your mental and physical health. Whether it's a 10-minute stretching session or a 10-mile run, movement makes winter more bearable. If you're not sure where to start, consider checking out the group fitness classes at the Nick and Bakke.  

  • Plan fun activities with friends: If the cold gets you down, make plans with friends. Grab dinner, host a movie night or plan a study session–anything to lift your spirits. 

  • Embrace seasonal activities: Take advantage of the things you can only do in the winter. If you've never tried skiing or snowboarding, maybe this is your year to try it. If you like ice skating, every year the Edgewater Hotel opens up an ice rink.  If you're more of an indoors person, try starting a new book or show or embrace the holiday season in whatever way is most meaningful to you. 

  • Treat yourself: Work can pile up quickly and in the winter months finding motivation can be even harder. It's important to treat yourself every once in a while. Buy that coffee or something you've been eyeing. Little rewards can make a big difference.
You've Got This! 

If you're feeling unmotivated and down this winter, remember there's plenty you can do to make these months more enjoyable. Brighter days (literally) are just around the corner. Before you know it, the Terrace chairs will be back out and you'll be doing your homework beside the lake. But for now, embrace this season and remember to stay warm!

subject: Learn what AI skills matter in the workforce and start building them
preview:
Join our webinar on practical steps you can take to prepare for the AI economy
 

Generative AI is already reshaping internships, coursework, and early-career roles. Whether you’re exploring majors or preparing to graduate, you’re probably wondering wh
body_html:
Join our webinar on practical steps you can take to prepare for the AI economy
 

Generative AI is already reshaping internships, coursework, and early-career roles. Whether you’re exploring majors or preparing to graduate, you’re probably wondering what it means for your future. What skills matter? How do you stand out? What’s hype vs. reality?

We're here to help! Join us on Wednesday, November 19 at 12:15PM PT/3:15PM ET.

 

Handshake’s Director of Research, Randy Tarnowski, and Viktor Gavrielov, Karuna Assistant Dean of the College for Career in Technology & Tech Ventures at Brown University, will share insights into:

  • How students like you are using (and not using) generative AI tools
  • What the findings mean for your near-term choices and career
  • Practical steps to thrive in the AI workforce (projects, coursework, portfolios)
  • What “AI skills” really means and how to start building them
RSVP here

Looking forward to seeing you for this chat!

    
 
You received this email because Handshake partners with your school to help you grow your career. Sign in to manage your notification preferences or unsubscribe.
P.O. Box 40770, San Francisco, CA 94140

subject: Final Event Reminder - DLS Presents: Trixie Mattel - Drag Queen, Artist, and Activist
preview:
Hello All,

This is a reminder for our upcoming event "An Evening With Trixie Mattel" on November 20th, 2025.  Please reach out if you have any questions about this event!

PLEASE NOTE: At 7:45pm non-ticket holders from the standby line will be let in
body_html:
Hello All, 

This is a reminder for our upcoming event "An Evening With Trixie Mattel" on November 20th, 2025.  Please reach out if you have any questions about this event!

PLEASE NOTE: At 7:45pm non-ticket holders from the standby line will be let into the hall to fill in any remaining seats. To ensure your seat is not given away please arrive and enter the hall by 7:45pm.  While there is a possibility of getting into the event without a ticket after 7:45pm, available seats without a ticket are NOT guaranteed. 

WUD DLS is excited to announce that drag queen, artist, and activist Trixie Mattel will be speaking at Shannon Hall, Memorial Union on Thursday, November 20th from 8-9:15 pm. The event, titled “An Evening With Trixie Mattel,” will feature a 75-minute moderated Q&A. Current University of Wisconsin–Madison students may register for tickets on Nov. 12 at 2pm Students will require a promo code, which they will receive via email, to acquire their ticket. Any remaining tickets will become available to the general public on Nov. 13 at 2pm, with a limit of one ticket per person. Registration for the event will be available on the Campus Arts Ticketing website. The event and tickets are FREE and open to students, faculty, the Madison community, and beyond!

A little more about Trixie Mattel:
Trixie Mattel is a drag performer, author, and recording artist best known for competing in the seventh season of RuPaul’s Drag Race and the winner of season three of RuPaul’s Drag Race All Stars.She has traveled the world touring with her hilarious comedy sets (Ages 3 and Up, Now With Moving Parts) and has appeared on television (American Horror Story: Roanoke, Larry King Now) and film (Trixie Mattel: Moving Parts), released her own make-up brand (Trixie Cosmetics), and co-wrote a book (Trixie and Katya's Guide to Modern Womanhood). She currently co-hosts the hit podcast “The Bald and the Beautiful” with Katya and appears on the award winning web series “UNHhhh” serving her unique brand of humor and over-the-top doll-like beauty.

If you have any questions/concerns about our events, or if you would like the poster for the event, please don't hesitate to reach out!

We hope to see you soon!
Annika McElduff

Annika McElduff
Associate Director of Outreach and Engagement
WUD Distinguished Lecture Series (DLS)
University of Wisconsin - Madison
Insta: @WUD_DLS

preview:

Is your RSO looking for visibility on campus? An opportunity to show UW-Madison what you have to offer?
body_html:
Join us tomorrow to learn more about potential collaborations for spring 2026!
Info Session: Tomorrow, Nov. 19 from 5:30-6:30 pm
Hey Badgers!

Is your RSO looking for visibility on campus? An opportunity to show UW-Madison what you have to offer? New member recruitment? Are you looking for volunteers, donors, or participants for an event? 

If you answered yes to any of the above, consider partnering with us, the Wisconsin Alumni Student Board (WASB), on our biggest event of the year: All-Campus Party (ACP). All-Campus Party is the nation’s largest, alcohol-alternative campus celebration. We host an event each day in late April (4/18-4/24), and your RSO could be a part of one!

From an Amazing Race-style scavenger hunt to a day dedicated to serving our community, or a massive block party on Lake Street, there are so many ways for you and your RSO to get involved. 

Come to our information session on Wednesday, November 19, from 5:30-6:30pm @ 650 N. Lake St to learn more!

Please email Nina, our Student Outreach Chair, at nanglim@wisc.edu to RSVP. 

We can’t wait to talk more with you about how to make this the best All-Campus Party ever!

-The Wisconsin Alumni Student Board

***You can learn more about us by visiting our general website and following us on Instagram!***

subject: REMINDER: Final Drop and Withdrawal Deadline is Mon, Nov. 24th
preview:
Dear Undergraduate Engineering Students,

The final deadline to drop course(s) or withdraw from the university is Monday, November 24th. If you are considering dropping a course or withdrawing, we encourage you to consult with your instructors and acade
body_html:
Dear Undergraduate Engineering Students,

The final deadline to drop course(s) or withdraw from the university is Monday, November 24th. If you are considering dropping a course or withdrawing, we encourage you to consult with your instructors and academic advisor as soon as possible.

If you plan to drop a course or withdraw from all your classes, the drop/withdrawal must be completed by 11:59 p.m. on Monday, November 24th. You should also confirm in your Student Center that you were successful in dropping the course(s).

Note: These deadlines only apply to full semester-length courses. To see the deadlines for other courses, check Course Search & Enroll.

INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS (F-1/J-1):  Please work with ISS before you attempt to drop or withdraw from the semester. Learn more Reduced Credit Loads or Leave of Absence.

DROP COURSE(S)

If you are unsure about whether to drop any course(s), I encourage you to take the following steps:

  • Speak with your instructor for the course(s) in question. Professors and TAs can help you understand where you stand in the course and what it will take to achieve a desired grade.
  • Communicate with your academic advisor. Your advisor is listed in your MyUW Student Center. Your advisor can help you understand the impact of dropping a class (e.g. meeting progression requirements, satisfying prerequisites for future courses, time to degree, remaining full-time).

Step-by-step instructions for dropping courses are at: https://kb.wisc.edu/registrar/15256
Please note that dropping a course is different from withdrawing from the semester. Withdrawal is described below.

WITHDRAW from UW-Madison

Withdrawing means the system will drop all of your courses and you will not remain an enrolled student. If you are considering withdrawing from all of your courses, you need to:

  • Contact your engineering academic advisor. Your advisor is listed in your MyUW Student Center. If you are considering a withdrawal, first speak to your advisor as soon as possible. Answers to questions about the withdrawal process and implications of withdrawing are at: https://kb.wisc.edu/registrar/25151.
  • Fill out and submit the online withdrawal form. The form is in your MyUW Student Center – Manage Classes – Enrollment Term Withdrawal: https://registrar.wisc.edu/how-to-withdraw/.
  • Medical withdrawal. Medical withdrawals may be granted to students who experience a serious or unexpected physical or behavioral health condition that precludes them from being able to function as a student; who may need to provide care to an immediate family member who is experiencing a serious or unexpected physical or behavioral health condition; or who have experienced the death of an immediate family member. Approval will be granted on a case-by-case basis. Learn more about medical withdrawal: https://registrar.wisc.edu/medical-withdrawal/.

Again, a withdrawal is only to be used if you want the university to drop all your courses and not remain a student for the rest of the semester.

NEED SUPPORT?

If you are concerned for the well-being of yourself or someone you know, please call UHS Mental Health helpline at 608-265-5600 (option 9) to speak with an on-call crisis counselor. This service is always available, including weekends, holidays, semester breaks, and all summer.

Uwill: UHS Mental Health Services (MHS) is partnering with Uwill to expand access to flexible, no-cost, virtual counseling options for UW-Madison students starting with 3 sessions with a Uwill counselor. Licensed mental health professionals are available for video, phone, chat, and message sessions during flexible hours – including nights and weekends. Students can get in quickly to see a counselor, with appointments typically available within 24 hours. https://www.uhs.wisc.edu/mental-health/uwill/

SPEAK with Assistant Dean Rachel Jones

Is there anything you need help with as you navigate the end of the semester? In my position, I often work with students to help them identify the challenges they are facing, understand all of their options moving forward, and then help them create strategies and plans to be successful. Your advisor and I want to work with you! Please feel free to respond to this email.

 

Rachel Jones
Assistant Dean for Student Services

College of Engineering
2640 Engineering Hall

Office: (608) 890-3692

rejones5@wisc.edu


Student Appointments Schedule HERE

 

“Education must not simply teach work—it must teach life.” W.E.B. Du Bois

 

Concerned about a student? Click here to fill out a student of concern report

 

UW-Madison 24-hour crisis services: 608.265.5600 (select option 9 for crisis services)

988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline (call or text 988)

E-mail is not checked outside of business hours or on weekends. If you are experiencing a crisis, please contact our 24-hour crisis services, dial 911, or go to your nearest emergency room.

subject: This Week in the Tech Lab - 11/18/25
preview:
Hi everyone,
We’re rolling into a big stretch of the semester — Badger Build Fest wrapped up this weekend, and Demo Night on December 3 is coming up fast!
Monday, Nov 17 – Open Lab (3:00–6:00 PM)
Drop by 1403 University Avenue to work, meet with Lab st
body_html:
Hi everyone,
We’re rolling into a big stretch of the semester — Badger Build Fest wrapped up this weekend, and Demo Night on December 3 is coming up fast!
Monday, Nov 17 – Open Lab (3:00–6:00 PM)
Drop by 1403 University Avenue to work, meet with Lab staff, or connect with other students.
Wednesday, Nov 18 – Virtual Office Hours (12:00–1:00 PM)
If you’d like a 15-minute slot, just reply and I’ll send you the link.
Thursday, Nov 19 – Open Lab + Demo Night Overview (3:00–6:00 PM)
Special Session: Join us at 4:00 for a quick walk-through of what to expect for the Dec. 3 Demo Night — format, logistics, how to prep, and time for questions. 
Friday, Nov 20 – Build Night (6:45–10:00 PM)
A great time to meet up with other builders, share ideas, and keep momentum going.
Badger Build Fest — Congrats to the Winners!
Huge congrats to all the teams who competed this weekend. You can explore every submission here: All Build Fest Submissions
December 3 – End-of-Semester Demo Night
Our poster-session-style showcase is almost here. You’ll demo your work to alumni, industry partners, and campus leaders. Teams from Venture Build, Self-directed Innovation, Industry Projects, and Build Fest are all welcome to host a table.
I’ll be sending a separate email this week with full prep details and to verify what you will be presenting.
Help us spread the word by sharing the RSVP with your clubs, friends, family, and anyone who might want to attend! And check in to  Discord for updates.

Sandra Bradley
Executive Director, UW Tech Exploration Lab
sandra.bradley@wisc.edu | Mobile: +1 608-239-3122

events.title: Virtual Office Hours
events.content: If you’d like a 15-minute slot, just reply and I’ll send you the link.

events.title: Open Lab + Demo Night Overview
events.content: Join us at 4:00 for a quick walk-through of what to expect for the Dec. 3 Demo Night — format, logistics, how to prep, and time for questions.

events.content: A great time to meet up with other builders, share ideas, and keep momentum going.

events.title: End-of-Semester Demo Night
events.content: Our poster-session-style showcase is almost here. You’ll demo your work to alumni, industry partners, and campus leaders. Teams from Venture Build, Self-directed Innovation, Industry Projects, and Build Fest are all welcome to host a table.

subject: Qdoba fundraiser for YesUW
preview:
Hi everyone!


Yes UW is hosting a fundraiser Today, Tuesday, November 18th, at Qdoba (Park Street location) from 4–8 PM!


25% of all proceeds will go directly toward supporting our club and helping us continue organizing awesome events like skydiv
body_html:
Hi everyone!


Yes UW is hosting a fundraiser Today, Tuesday, November 18th, at Qdoba (Park Street location) from 4–8 PM!


25% of all proceeds will go directly toward supporting our club and helping us continue organizing awesome events like skydiving, Devil’s Lake trips, and the Polar Plunge.

Bring your friends, meet new people, and don’t forget to mention “Yes UW” at the register so your order counts toward our fundraiser!


We can’t wait to see you all there and appreciate your support!


Maria De Martino

VP of Operations 

Seek Discomfort!

todos.content: mention “Yes UW” at the register so your order counts toward our fundraiser

events.content: Yes UW is hosting a fundraiser. 25% of all proceeds will go directly toward supporting our club and helping us continue organizing awesome events like skydiving, Devil’s Lake trips, and the Polar Plunge. Bring your friends, meet new people.

hr

Pre-workout comment

1 lap = 0.55miles. Going up the pyramid, keep effort the same at a tempo as the distances get longer. Coming back down to shorter intervals, start increasing pace if able.

Description

Warmup from Bascom to the Square on this route- https://ridewithgps.com/routes/53319782

Group 1- 1 lap 6:00, 3x2 laps 12:00, 1 lap

Group 2- 1 lap 5:30, 2 laps 10:30, 3 laps 15:00, 2 laps 10:30, 1 lap

Group 3- 1 lap 4:30, 2 laps 9:00, 4 laps 17:00, 2 laps 9:00, 1 lap

Cool down State St back to Bascom, or home

View Workout

Wednesday, November 19

Workout

WiTri- Swim-a-thon at team practice

Description

Warmup time- 20 minutes. 300 swim, 50 kick, 3x50 drill/swim, 3-5x100

30 minute swim-a-thon. Swim continuously or your choice

View Workout
Workout

WiTri- Strength Workout 3

Time

1

hr

Pre-workout comment

There is not an official team strength workout as a group, but this can be done on your own or w/training partner(s) on your own time. Does not have to be on Wednesday, can be on whatever day fits your schedule the best. If any questions about proper lifting technique for specific a specific exercise, do not attempt if unsure on technique to avoid risking injury. Ask coach or other team member who is experienced with lifting. Amount of weight used should be challenging on the last few reps but not maxing out- do not risk failure. If unsure of how much weight to use, start on the conservative/lighter side, and increase from there as you feel able.

Description

~5 minute warmup- either choice aerobic exercise or a variety of body weight exercises

~5 minutes light stretching

3x6 of the following exercises:
-RDL or trap bar deadlift
-Pullups or lat pull downs
-Calf raises
-Single arm dumbbell chest press

8 core exercises of choice- 45 seconds on/15 seconds rest for each

~5min stretching

View Workout

subject: Contribute to the Science of Flexible Thinking, Emotion and Sleep
preview:
View Online Version
What is STRENGTHEN?

Flexible thinking, emotion, and sleep study.

The purpose of this study is to understand the impact of two different types of activities:
Painless electrical brain stimulation delivered during sleep, and
Bri
body_html:
View Online Version
What is STRENGTHEN?

Flexible thinking, emotion, and sleep study.

The purpose of this study is to understand the impact of two different types of activities:
Painless electrical brain stimulation delivered during sleep, and
Brief, daily well-being training. 

We are trying to figure out whether these activities, either alone or combined, can positively impact the brain. Our goal is to increase the ability to think flexibly and to regulate emotions.

What you’ll do in this study:
1) Do 8 to 12 in-person visits over the course of 5-6 months. These visits will include:
  • Up to 9 overnights at Wisconsin Institute of Sleep and Consciousness with most visits involving transcranial electrical stimulation while you sleep.
  • 2 visits to the Waisman Center to do computer tasks, questionnaires, and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)
2) Complete questionnaires at home.

3) Use the Healthy Minds Program on your mobile phone for 4 weeks.

4) Do surveys on your phone 6 times a day for three weeks: one week at the beginning, one week in the middle, and one week at the end of the study.
  • Each survey takes about 2 minutes to complete.
  • Surveys need to be completed throughout the day because we are trying to learn more about how people are feeling as they live their daily lives.
5) About 4 months after these in-person visits, repeat some of the questionnaires and tasks on your phone.

Take a short survey to see if you are eligible now.

To be eligible, you must:
  • Be 18-50 years old
  • Have access to a smartphone
  • Have no regular meditation practice
  • Complete online health status screening
  • Be able to attend overnight visits at the Wisconsin Institute of Sleep and Consciousness
Compensation:
People who complete the full study may receive up to $2,440.

Questions?
We’re happy to hear from you.

Email: strengthen@chm.wisc.edu
Phone: 608-890-2960

This study is led by the Center for Healthy Minds and the Wisconsin Institute of Sleep and Consciousness at the University of Wisconsin –Madison under the direction of Richard Davidson, PhD and Giulio Tononi, MD, PhD. It is approved by its Institutional Review Board, which is charged with protecting the rights and welfare of people who take part in research studies.
 
 
The University of Wisconsin-Madison allows researchers to use email to send its faculty, staff, and students information about research opportunities as part of its research mission. The content of this email message has been approved by an Institutional Review Board (IRB). IRBs are charged with protecting the rights and welfare of people who take part in research studies.
Privacy Policy  |   Unsubscribe

todos.content: Take a short survey to see if you are eligible for the STRENGTHEN study.
Complete online health status screening for STRENGTHEN study eligibility.
Attend up to 9 overnight visits at the Wisconsin Institute of Sleep and Consciousness, involving transcranial electrical stimulation during sleep.
Attend 2 visits to the Waisman Center to do computer tasks, questionnaires, and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).
Complete questionnaires at home for the STRENGTHEN study.
Use the Healthy Minds Program on your mobile phone for 4 weeks.
Complete surveys on your phone 6 times a day for three weeks (one week at the beginning, one week in the middle, and one week at the end of the study).
Repeat some questionnaires and tasks on your phone approximately 4 months after the in-person visits.

subject: 2025 UW-Madison Sustainability Survey
preview:
Dear Evan Liu,

This fall, UW–Madison earned its first STARS Gold rating in a broad sustainability assessment. This milestone marks progress toward Chancellor Jennifer Mnookin’s five environmental sustainability goals announced in February 2024. STARS r
body_html:
Dear Evan Liu,

This fall, UW–Madison earned its first STARS Gold rating in a broad sustainability assessment. This milestone marks progress toward Chancellor Jennifer Mnookin’s five environmental sustainability goals announced in February 2024. STARS reporting is a point-based system used by colleges and universities to measure campus sustainability efforts and compare them with those of peer institutions. 

As we continue to advance our sustainability goals, we need to hear from you to better understand sustainability literacy, culture, and demand within our campus community. 

This is a reminder to please complete the survey by December 10, 2025, to have your voice heard. Your answers help shape on-the-ground sustainability efforts at UW–Madison.

Follow this link to the Survey:
Take the survey

Or copy and paste the URL below into your internet browser:
https://uwmadison.co1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_eWerhzMEYz4IgfA?Q_DL=vff0u486IkG5rD4_eWerhzMEYz4IgfA_CGC_RzDWlY2QTiT7CZt&Q_RD=EMD_tp5HNDkslyJP71y&Q_CHL=email

Thank you in advance for taking a few minutes to complete the survey, 

Andrea L. Hicks, PhD
Associate Professor 
Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering
Keith and Jane Nosbusch Associate Professor
Hanson Family Fellow in Sustainability
Director of Sustainability Education and Research 
Assistant Dean of Sustainability Education and Research
University of Wisconsin Madison 

Follow the link to opt out of future emails:
Click here to unsubscribe

todos.content: Complete the 2025 UW-Madison Sustainability Survey

subject: dotData Weekly Newsletter
preview:
Hello Data Scientists!
Welcome to dotData's weekly newsletter! We hope you've been having a great semester. In this newsletter, you will find information about upcoming club meetings, dotData projects, links to our socials, and new opportunities to g
body_html:
Hello Data Scientists!

Welcome to dotData's weekly newsletter! We hope you've been having a great semester. In this newsletter, you will find information about upcoming club meetings, dotData projects, links to our socials, and new opportunities to get involved as a member of dotData!

Club Meetings

This Week: Alumni Exec Panel + Resume Review

We’re kicking things off with a Resume Review – submit your resume to this Google Form and get real-time, constructive feedback to help you level up your applications. Afterward, stick around for an Alumni Panel featuring dotData executive board members. They'll share their experiences navigating internships and careers in data science, analytics, and tech. Expect honest insights into industry life, the challenges they faced, and the advice they wish they’d received. 

Date & Time: Wednesday, 11/19 @ 6pm
Location: Morgridge Hall 2532

 

Next Week: No Meeting, Happy Thanksgiving!

Meeting Slides

Here are the slides from our previous meetings in case you missed it, make sure to fill in the event suggestion and merch interest form!
Agents and AI - Matthew Bruehl from NVIDIA
Data Engineering with Amber Olson from AmFam
Meeting Slides for Infer-X 
Infer-X interest form
Kickoff Fall 2025 Slides
Club Collab with Tech Exploration Lab and Google
Data Science in Sports Analytics
 

Opportunities

dotData Merch!

Are you interested in owning dotData merch? Fill in the form below and we will be sharing some cool designs soon!
Merch Interest Form
 

Resume review

Want your résumé to be reviewed by top-notch grad (and former dotData President!) Gautam? Submit your résumé pdf/doc to this Google Form to get it individually reviewed. Depending on demand, expect a few weeks for an annotated response. Please review Gautam's résumé template (create a copy) before submitting your own.
 

Member Spotlight

Are you or someone you know working on an exciting tech project, startup, or data science initiative?
We’d love to showcase your work in our newsletter and on our social platforms.
Please reach out to us on Instagram to be featured!

Socials

dotData Instagram

Stay up to date with club meeting information, find opportunities to get involved, and bonus, get to see behind the scenes pictures from our events! Follow our instagram!


dotData Google Calendar

Use this link to add our official Data Science Club calendar to your Google Calendar! Our calendar has information about club meetings, office hours, and more! 


dotData LinkedIn Group

Join our new private LinkedIn group for networking with current and former dotData members! Only active members who have been to meetings will be admitted. Please note: attendance for at least four meetings is required to be accepted! Being in the dotData group will be displayed on your profile! Follow our public page too.


dotData slack

Are you an active member of dotData? Join our slack page here to stay up to date on everything dotData!

Event Suggestions and Review

Want to see a certain workshop, event, or concept covered? Tell us here!

    Instagram
    Slack
    Website
    LinkedIn


    --
    You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "dotdata" group.
    To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to dotdata+unsubscribe@g-groups.wisc.edu.
    To view this discussion visit https://groups.google.com/a/g-groups.wisc.edu/d/msgid/dotdata/CAAoJV33gM8tW-7tSvnG_-y8jjQagnZoVkbv9NiatK3LgvhxrgQ%40mail.gmail.com.

­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­


ACC Just Hosted Our Largest Campus Event Yet!


More than 300 students showed up to learn about our energy future at Texas A&M University! This marks ACC’s largest campus event ever – and we’re just getting started.

With a line out the door just minutes before the event started, ACC and the Hamm Institute for American Energy filled an auditorium at The Bush School with students ready to learn about the importance of American energy leadership.


In partnership with Turning Point USA at A&M, ACC and the Hamm Institute brought Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins, a proud Aggie, back to campus to discuss her unique career path and approach to energy issues.


We were also joined by Devon Energy CEO Clay Gaspar, Howard Energy CEO Mike Howard, and Entra1 Energy’s Skip Alvarado. George & Barbara Bush Foundation CEO Alice Yates gave opening remarks to kick off the event.


Following the event, students were encouraged to join The Legacy Center, a jobs board for energy and conservation work. This is a continuation of our commitment to empower students and young professionals to pursue mission-driven work.


The Energy Freedom Tour will continue in the spring with stops at UNC Chapel Hill, Ohio State University, and the University of Colorado Boulder.

Stay Up to Date With the Energy Freedom Tour!

We look forward to unleashing American energy with each and every one of you in 2026!


Onward,

Chris Barnard

President, ACC

American Conservation Coalition · 1100 H Street NW · Suite 1200 · Washington, DC 20005 · USA

subject: Enroll from the waitlist for E M A 202 by Nov 20
preview:
Evan,

You can now enroll in this Spring 2025-2026 wait-listed class — E M A 202 (303): “Dynamics” (class number 52237 ).

This permission will expire at 11:59pm on Nov 20.

*Decided not to take this class?

Please remove this class from your wai
body_html:
Evan,

You can now enroll in this Spring 2025-2026 wait-listed class — E M A 202 (303): “Dynamics” (class number 52237 ).

This permission will expire at 11:59pm on Nov 20.

*Decided not to take this class?

Please remove this class from your wait list via Course Search & Enroll. This can help other wait-listed students get permission faster.

*HOW TO ENROLL IN THIS CLASS

Note: If enrolling in this class would cause you to exceed your maximum allowed credits for a term, you’ll need to swap with one of your currently enrolled classes. Depending on your academic program, adding another class may change your tuition assessment. Please contact the Bursar’s Office with questions about tuition adjustments (bursar.wisc.edu/tuition-and-fees/tuition-adjustment).

  1. Log into Course Search & Enroll (enroll.wisc.edu)
  2. Go to your “Wait list” list in the “My Courses” tab and select the appropriate term
  3. Select the checkbox for the class
  4. Select the “Enroll” button.
  5. Review your “Enrolled” list to confirm that you have successfully enrolled

Questions? Please reply to this email for further assistance.

todos.content: Enroll in E M A 202 (303): 'Dynamics' (class number 52237) for Spring 2025-2026 from the waitlist.
Remove E M A 202 (303) from your wait list via Course Search & Enroll if you decide not to take the class.

subject: Spring Co-Op Orientation- TODAY (11/18)-- 1-2 pm, EH 1610
preview:
Good morning,

If you have accepted a co-op offer for the Spring semester, please see important details regarding the upcoming Engineering Career Services Spring Co-op Orientation happening TODAY--

  *
Tuesday, November 18th from 1:00-2:00 pm in Eng
body_html:
Good morning,

If you have accepted a co-op offer for the Spring semester, please see important details regarding the upcoming Engineering Career Services Spring Co-op Orientation happening TODAY--
  • Tuesday, November 18th from 1:00-2:00 pm in Engineering Hall #1610

Attending an orientation is the first step in getting authorized for the required co-op course.  Attendance is welcomed regardless of whether you have reported your Spring co-op on Handshake or not.  During the orientation session, ECS will cover all aspects of the co-op process from reporting & authorization to course expectations.  Please make sure you attend!  You do not need to register for the session.  The orientation is scheduled as a 60 minute period.


If you are still seeking a co-op for the Spring or waiting to hear on a potential offer, no need to attend.  You can always attend an orientation at a later date. 


You can find more Co-Op information by utilizing the link to the ECS webpage below:

https://ecs.wisc.edu/students/co-op-and-internship/academic-credit/


Drew Graf

Career Services Advisor

Engineering Career Services

University of Wisconsin-Madison

aagraf@wisc.edu

ecs.wisc.edu

608-262-3356

Schedule an Appointment: https://go.wisc.edu/ecs.appt.graf

View this email in your browser

Ornament Making & Election Information


Join us this Wednesday to make ornaments for the College Republicans Christmas tree and learn how to run in our exec board election. If you want to run in the election, you must fill out the application form by NOVEMBER 26TH. If you cannot attend the meeting on Wednesday, reach out to me (Courtney) at clgraves@wisc.edu to get the form. If you want to run, I strongly recommend attending the upcoming meeting. The election will be held on Monday, December 8th, at 6:30 PM. If you are running, be sure that you can attend the election to make a short speech and cast your vote! To vote or run in the election, you must be a dues-paying member. Again, reach out if you have any questions or concerns.

2025 Christmas Party!

Exciting news: our Christmas party will be on Wednesday, Dec. 8th. It is going to be at Sett Recreation in Union South. There will be bowling and free food. It will be a great way to end the semester with some fellow Republicans. Hope to see everyone there!

Join our GroupMe

Follow us on Instagram @gopbadgers

 

Copyright (C) 2025 College Republicans of UW-Madison. All rights reserved.

College Republicans of UW-Madison 1001 University Ave Unit 515 Madison, WI 53715-1020 USA

The Transcend Podcast is back!



This week we sit down with Christina Henderson — a full-time anesthesiology resident at UW Health and the founder of Reliable Residence, the fast-growing startup she built to solve the housing nightmare she experienced as a med student. Christina shares what it’s really like to build a company while working hospital shifts, and how she turned a personal pain point into a rapidly scaling venture.

In this episode:

💡 The lightbulb moment that sparked Reliable Residence

🤝 Building partnerships from zero (including walking into a developer’s office unannounced)

⏱️ Productivity systems for founders juggling demanding schedules

🏥 How medical training can strengthen entrepreneurial skills

… and more!

Podcast Link
 


Transcend x TEL Build Nights

Every Friday, 6:45–10 PM at TEL (1403 University Ave)



A weekly creative reset featuring snacks, games, open build time, and on-hand startup and technical mentors from Transcend and the UW Tech Exploration Lab — come for the vibes, stay for the breakthroughs. 🛠️✨

Build Nights Registration Page
 


Transcend Entrepreneurial Meetups


Our biweekly gathering brings together UW–Madison’s builders, founders, innovators, and future investors — an evolution of last year’s Ramp100 meetups. Whether you’re launching a venture, exploring an idea, or just want to plug into the campus startup scene, this is the place to be.


Expect open conversations, idea-sharing, and plenty of chances to meet the people shaping what’s next at UW. It’s a networking space with chill vibes: snacks, board games, and the occasional unexpected spark of fun.


Come connect with the doers, dreamers, and deal-makers — and help us build a campus where innovation thrives.

Entrepreneurial Meetups Registration
 

Want to join the Transcend Exec Team??


Although Transcend isn’t currently seeking new members, you can still apply using the form below, and the Exec Team will contact you if a need arises and you’re selected.

Exec Team Application Form
 


Attend a D2P Open House


If you can dream it, D2P can help.

Learn about free trainings and mentoring available to campus innovators at a virtual Open
House with Discovery to Product (D2P)!

 

Open Houses

Open houses are held monthly on select weekdays and alternate between 12:30-1pm and 4:30-5pm. All are held virtually and are open to UW–Madison faculty, students and staff.

D2P Website
 

Stay updated on the latest Transcend events!!

Transcend Events Luma
 

Joke of the week:



Why did the founder bring a ladder to the board meeting?
Because they were ready to scale. 🪜

 


Cheers,
The Transcend Crew

subject: High-Speed Rail Research Survey
preview:
Hi Badgers!
I am working on a project for Ed Pol 320 (Climate Change, Sustainability, and Education) that focuses on how students at UW-Madison understand high-speed rail and climate solutions in the United States. As part of this, I am collecting data f
body_html:
Hi Badgers!
I am working on a project for Ed Pol 320 (Climate Change, Sustainability, and Education) that focuses on how students at UW-Madison understand high-speed rail and climate solutions in the United States. As part of this, I am collecting data from individuals about their awareness, misconceptions, and the sources from which they get information about transportation issues. This survey is completely anonymous and will help me understand how people view high-speed rail.
If you have 1-2 minutes, please fill out the short anonymous survey linked in this email. Thank you for your help!
Ed Pol 320 Project Survey
HSR Research Survey


Thank you, 
Jordan

subject: EBE Final Meeting of the Semester – Resume/LinkedIn Workshop + Elections (11/19)
preview:
Hi everyone,

I hope you’re all doing well! We’re excited to host one of our final EBE meetings of the semester this Wednesday, November 19th, from 5:30–6:30 PM in Grainger 2210RS.

This week’s meeting will feature a Resume & LinkedIn Workshop to help
body_html:
Hi everyone,

I hope you’re all doing well! We’re excited to host one of our final EBE meetings of the semester this Wednesday, November 19th, from 5:30–6:30 PM in Grainger 2210RS.

This week’s meeting will feature a Resume & LinkedIn Workshop to help you strengthen your professional presence as you head into spring recruiting. We’ll walk through best practices, examples, and quick improvements you can make on the spot.

We will also be holding an open discussion on next semester’s executive board elections. All positions will be up for election, so if you’re interested in taking on a leadership role within EBE, this is a great chance to learn more about each position and what the election process will look like.

We hope to see you all there!

Best,
Kyle


Get Outlook for Mac

subject: Exam 2 Late Night Review: ECE230: Circuit Analysis (001) FA25
preview:
Hello everyone,

Due to popular demand, I will be hosting a review at 8 PM tonight at Chamberlin Hall or EHall (will announce later). This review will be conducted differently. I will prepare/create 4-5 new questions I believe you should know how to sol
body_html:
Hello everyone,

Due to popular demand, I will be hosting a review at 8 PM tonight at Chamberlin Hall or EHall (will announce later). This review will be conducted differently. I will prepare/create 4-5 new questions I believe you should know how to solve and will let you work on them as I do my hw. I will go over the solutions afterwards. Depending on an in-person vote, we can run it like a mock exam or go question by question.

NOTE: These questions may not encompass all of the possible exam content and wont be reflective of the actual exam.

Sincerely, 

Vincent Iadarola

The format (mock exam or question by question) will be decided by an in-person vote. Note: These questions may not encompass all possible exam content and won't be reflective of the actual exam.

subject: Your Bonus Elite Night Credits are waiting...
body_html:
Register now to make every night count twice!
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
Web Version

SIGN IN

|

Club

EVERY NIGHT COUNTS TWICE

REGISTER NOW

*Terms apply

InterContinental Halong Bay Resort

Evan, double your travel fun through the end of the year! Register now to earn 1 Bonus Elite Night Credit every night you stay between ‌Oct‌ob‌er 1 and ‍December 31, 2025, up to 10 total nights.

Your exclusive offer makes every night you stay count twice, getting you closer to enjoying Silver Elite status through 2026 and earning your next Milestone Reward!*

How it works:

Register now

Earn 1 Bonus Elite Night Credit each night you stay

Up to 10 Bonus Elite Night Credits

REGISTER NOW

*Terms apply

Stay Offers
Meetings Our Brands
Download the IHG One Rewards App

Terms and Conditions

*The "Up to 10 Bonus Elite Night Credits" promotional offer (the "Offer") provides you with an opportunity to earn one “Bonus Elite Night Credit” for each Offer-Qualifying Room Night stayed during the Offer Period, up to a maximum of ten (10) Bonus Elite Night Credits. For each “Bonus Elite Night Credit” you earn under the Offer, you will be credited with an additional Elite Qualifying Night for purposes of determining Elite membership status and Milestone Rewards earned under the IHG One Rewards program in 2025. “Bonus Elite Night Credits” do not qualify as Rollover Nights or as Qualifying Nights for any other purpose or benefit under the IHG One Rewards program. Additional information on achieving the different tiers of Elite status and the associated benefits is provided in the IHG One Rewards Membership Terms and Conditions, and details about Milestone Rewards can be found here.

To participate in this Offer, you must be an IHG One Rewards member and must be invited to participate. After receiving an invitation, you must register your member number in advance in order to be eligible for the Offer. Members can pre-register for this Offer between ‍September 15 and ‍September 30, 2025 (the ‘Pre-Registration Period’). The “Promotion Period” is from ‍October 1, 2025, through ‍December 31, 2025. Members who did not register during the Pre-Registration Period may register for the Offer during the Promotion Period. A member can only register once. The member must register before completing any stays during the Promotion Period in order for them to count towards the Offer. By registering for the Offer, a member is accepting these Terms and Conditions.

After registering, a member can earn up to a maximum of ten (10) Bonus Elite Night Credits under this Offer, as follows: one (1) Bonus Elite Night Credit will be awarded to the member’s IHG One Rewards account after each Offer-Qualifying Room Night stay during the Promotion Period. For example, if a member has stays that result in a total of three (3) Offer-Qualifying Room Nights during the Promotion Period, the member would earn three (3) Bonus Elite Night Credits. These Bonus Elite Night Credits are in addition to any base Elite Qualifying Nights the member earns for their stays.  As a result, in the above example, in addition to the three (3) Bonus Elite Night Credits, the member would also be credited with three (3) base Elite Qualifying Nights, effectively giving the member credit for 6 Elite Qualifying Nights towards earning Elite status and Milestone Rewards in 2025. To be an "Offer-Qualifying Room Night" under this Offer, the room night must fall within the Promotion Period and must be part of a Promotion Eligible Qualifying Stay. As noted above, the “Promotion Period” is from ‍October 1, 2025, through ‍December 31, 2025. Room nights outside of the Promotion Period are not included, and room nights that are part of a stay that was completed prior to registration for the Offer also are not included.

For purposes of this Offer, a “Promotion Eligible Qualifying Stay” is defined as a minimum one (1) night stay at a participating hotel booked under a Qualifying Rate with total spend exceeding USD $30 (or local currency equivalent) for each night. Participating hotels include all IHG® Hotels & Resorts, with the exception of those Six Senses® Hotels Resorts Spas and Iberostar Beachfront Resorts that do not participate in the IHG One Rewards program.  Stays booked using Reward Nights or Points & Cash are not Promotion Eligible Qualifying Stays for purposes of this Offer. Bookings made through on-line travel agencies or other reservation sites such as b‍o‍o‍k‍i‍n‍g‍.‍c‍o‍m or e‍x‍ped‍i‍a‍.‍c‍o‍m also do not qualify under this Offer. (For additional details on Qualifying Rates, please see the IHG One Rewards Membership Terms and Conditions). If more than one member who registered for the Offer checks into the same room, only one member is eligible to earn Bonus Elite Night Credits under this Offer based on those nights that qualify. If a member books more than one room on the same night, the member will only receive credit towards this Offer for only one of the rooms that also meets the requirements of an Offer-Qualifying Room Night. 

A member’s participation in the IHG One Rewards program and this Offer are subject to the standard IHG One Rewards Membership Terms and Conditions, which can be obtained here or by visiting ihgonerewards.com. The time needed for awarding Bonus Elite Night Credits can vary with each promotion, so please allow up to 6 weeks for the Bonus Elite Night Credits to be posted to the recipient’s member account.

subject: Session 3 Key Materials & Next Steps for Startup Foundations Workshops
preview:
Dear Startup Foundations Participants,

Thank you for joining us—or registering—for the third session of the Startup Foundations workshop series: “Nailing Your Value Proposition”.

Key Takeaways from Session 3

We explored how to:

  *   Understan
body_html:
Dear Startup Foundations Participants,

Thank you for joining us—or registering—for the third session of the Startup Foundations workshop series: “Nailing Your Value Proposition”.

Key Takeaways from Session 3

We explored how to:

  • Understand the contextual nature of value—how it depends on customer needs, alternatives, and pain points.
  • Use mapping tools (ecosystem, stakeholder, value chain, decision process) to visualize customer environments and adoption pathways.
  • Define a value proposition that focuses on customer benefits rather than product features.
  • Align your evidence with the three levels of fit: problem-solution, product-market, and business model.
  • Apply the Value Proposition Canvas to connect customer jobs, pains, and gains with your offering.
  • Craft clear, quantifiable, and differentiated value propositions that resonate with your target audience.

Attached Resources to Support Your Progress:

  • Summary Document: Nailing Your Value Proposition
  • Nailing Your Value Proposition Worksheet

Your Next Step

We’d love to support your progress. During the session, we asked who might be interested in a follow-up mentor conversation, but we realized afterward that the survey didn’t collect names. So unfortunately, we’re not sure who responded!

If you'd like to schedule a one-on-one conversation about your idea or project, please reply directly to this email (not “Reply All”) and we’ll be happy to follow up.

 Warm regards,
Cecily Brose and Abram Becker


Cecily Brose

Innovation and Commercialization Mentor

UW‑Madison Discovery to Product (D2P)

Hours: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday 9am – 5pm

cecily.brose@wisc.edu | +1 (608) 890 2885

D2P Website | Innovate Website

subject: Get Free Help with Your Class Projects! Plus Submit Your Work to the Digital Salon!
preview:
Get help with your class projects!

Need help getting started? No problem! Want a second set of eyes before you turn it in? We're here to help! DesignLab consultants can help with everything from conceptualizing the first steps to polishing a nearly fin
body_html:
Get help with your class projects!

Need help getting started? No problem! Want a second set of eyes before you turn it in? We're here to help! DesignLab consultants can help with everything from conceptualizing the first steps to polishing a nearly finished project, and all the steps along the way!

We offer both in-person and virtual appointments, as well as a chat/text service. And it's all free!

Get help with:

  • Presentation Slides/Visual Aids
  • Research Posters
  • Resumes / CVs
  • Website / Blog Design
  • Brochures / Fliers
  • Graphic Essays / Comics
  • Infographics
  • Data Visualizations
  • Videos / Audio
  • and more!
Make an Appointment

DesignLab Hours and Locations

College Library, 600 N. Park Street
(Helen C. White Hall Room 2250, 2nd Floor Computer Lab)

Mondays & Tuesdays              1 pm - 5 pm
Wednesdays - Fridays            11 am - 3 pm

Memorial Library, 728 State Street

(2nd Floor West Corridor, Digital Scholarship Hub)

Tuesdays                     3 - 7 pm
Wednesdays             1 - 5 pm
Thursdays                  1 - 5 pm

Ebling Library, 750 Highland Ave

(Health Sciences Learning Center, 2nd Floor)

Tuesdays                    10 pm - 2 pm

Morgridge Hall, 1205 University Ave

(2nd Floor, Rebecca M. Blank Student Commons, Room 2592)

Wednesdays             3 - 7 pm

(All times are listed as Central Standard Time)

Now Accepting Submissions!


The 17th Annual Digital Salon Exhibition is currently accepting student-made submissions! The online exhibition and the in-person showcase will open in April 2026 at the College Library.

Digital Salon is a curated exhibition of media projects—including videos, animations, graphic essays, posters, infographics, websites, podcasts, blogs, and more—open to all UW-Madison undergraduate and graduate students, with prizes for Best-in-Show and Honorable Mentions.
Submit Your Work
Submission Deadline: Monday, March 31st, 2026

Digital Salon is co-organized by the DesignLab and the UW-Libraries. More information at designlab.wisc.edu/digitalsalon
Copyright © 2025 DesignLab, All rights reserved.

This email was sent to all students via a curated Google Group from DoIT.
Learn more about Google Lists and manage your UW-Madison Google Groups Email Preferences here: https://it.wisc.edu/services/google-groups/

subject: Cosmic bowling night! 🎳
preview:
View this email in your browser

🎳  ✨

Join us this week for bowling night at the Sett Rec in Union South!  We have two lanes reserved for an hour this Thursday night, meet us at 7:45pm!  It’ll be fun and generally laid-back, unless you bring that co
body_html:
View this email in your browser

🎳  ✨

Join us this week for bowling night at the Sett Rec in Union South!  We have two lanes reserved for an hour this Thursday night, meet us at 7:45pm!  It’ll be fun and generally laid-back, unless you bring that competitive spirit. 

Next week we will not have a meeting, as it is Thanksgiving!  Have a good break, and we’ll look forward to seeing you Thursday December 4th for our research symposium!  This is our annual event where students can present a 5 or 10-minute talk on their research work.  It’s a great opportunity to practice presenting in a low-stress environment.  If you’re interested in presenting, you can sign up ✨here✨

There’s also an outreach event at Kennedy Elementary School the evening of December 4th.  We need some folks to help here!  If that’s something you could volunteer for, please consider signing up ✨here!✨

Space fact of the week:
The Aurora Borealis, seen here in this photo by former President Nadia Talbi, is the result of glowing gas in our upper atmosphere, similar to inside a fluorescent lightbulb.  But did you know that some say the aurora can make a noise?  Typically reported only during extremely strong activity and at high latitudes, people report a hiss, crackle, or popping.  Scientists are still undecided on whether this is a real phenomenon relating to or caused by the aurora.  If you hear it, make sure it’s not a nearby power line…

Stay ballin’

The Astronomy Club Exec Board

subject: Welcome to Cursor!
preview:
Hi Evan,

Cursor is now active! Here are a few ways to get started:

- Start typing and, when an autocomplete suggestion appears, press Tab to accept it
- Highlight a selection of code and press Cmd/Ctrl+K to make an inline edit
- Open Agent to make
body_html:
Hi Evan,

Cursor is now active! Here are a few ways to get started:

- Start typing and, when an autocomplete suggestion appears, press Tab to accept it
- Highlight a selection of code and press Cmd/Ctrl+K to make an inline edit
- Open Agent to make edits across multiple files
- Run Agents from web & mobile
- Use Bugbot to review your pull requests

You can learn more in our docs or reach us with any questions on the forum

Best,
Cursor Team


If you don't want to hear from us again, please let us know.
