subject: ASME Weekly 11/17/2025
preview:
Happy Week 12!
One month left, we're almost done!
This Week in ASME
General Meeting with Vyron


Tuesday, 11/18 in ME 1106
Free Culvers!
Join us Tuesday, 11/18 at 5:30pm in ME 1106 for our general meeting with Vyron. Vyron Corporation has served t
body_html:
Happy Week 12!

One month left, we're almost done!
This Week in ASME
General Meeting with Vyron
 


Tuesday, 11/18 in ME 1106
Free Culvers!

Join us Tuesday, 11/18 at 5:30pm in ME 1106 for our general meeting with Vyron. Vyron Corporation has served the needs of facility owners, mechanical contractors, and mechanical engineers with sound HVAC advice. Vyron Corporation is an HVAC Manufacturer's Representative in the Midwest that serves the State of Wisconsin and Upper Peninsula of Michigan since 1955.

We are excited to see you there!
 
ASHRAE Meeting

Are you interested in energy systems, renewable energy, cryogenics, or thermodynamics? ASHRAE is the perfect club for you! 



Our next ASHRAE meeting will be today, 11/17 from 4:30 to 6:30 in ERB 138. Join our Teams for more updates about ASHRAE. We are excited to see you there!

Check Teams for updates!

Everyone is welcome to join, no matter your major or grade level. 
Please share this email with anyone who might be interested. 


Please reach out to Madison Kulinski mkulinski@wisc.edu if you have any questions.
Design Team

Join the ASME Design Team! The ASME Design Team is back to take on an exciting new experience similar to a senior design project! Whether you're a beginner or an experienced engineer, you'll have the chance to get certified on essential tools, gain hands-on design experience, and learn how to communicate professionally with clients. Plus, there are leadership positions available for those passionate about making an impact this year! 

Our next Design Team meeting will be on Thursday 11/20 from 6pm to 7pm in ME 1235. We're looking forward to seeing you there!

Everyone is welcome to join, not matter your major or grade level. 
Please share this email with anyone who might be interested. 


Please reach out to Braxton Roeder bwroeder@wisc.edu or Kris Cha kccha@wisc.edu if you have an y questions. 
Upcoming Events:
ASME Resume Book

ASME Is collecting resumes to extend to potential employers. Come to the ASME office to drop off your resume and fill out THIS FORM to allow us access to distribute your resume to employers.

Please reach out to Jonas Price joprice@wisc.edu with any questions.

ASME Mentoring

Looking to connect with other Mechanical Engineering students? ASME is launching a Mentorship Program pairing general members with officers who are excited to share their experiences and help you succeed.

Our mentors bring a wide variety of perspectives—ranging from internships, co-ops, and research experiences to leadership and involvement across campus. Whether you’re seeking guidance on classes, career opportunities, or how to get involved at UW, this program is a great way to build connections and gain valuable insights! 

Join our Teams
Get all your ASHRAE, Design Team, and Industry Corner information in one place! 

ASME Office Hours

Stop by to take a look at our extensive collection of past exams, get some ASME merch, or just to say hi!
Follow ASME on Instagram and Linkedin and check out our website

Please reach out to joprice@wisc.edu with any questions.

Copyright (C) 2025 ASME UW-Madison. All rights reserved.

subject: Final Reminder: Win $200 for your RSO for giving Student Activity Center (SAC) Resign Feedback
preview: Final Reminder: Student Affairs is inviting student organizations to share their thoughts on the Student Activity Center as part of an ongoing study. Whether your group uses the space regularly or just now and then, your feedback is essential in helping u
body_html:
Final Reminder: Student Affairs is inviting student organizations to share their thoughts on the Student Activity Center as part of an ongoing study. Whether your group uses the space regularly or just now and then, your feedback is essential in helping us understand how the space can better support students and promote engagement. 
 
Attend a virtual feedback session and your student organization will be entered into a drawing for one of ten $200 grants, which can be used for any university-allowable expenses - including food! 
 
  • Session Options (RSVP here to receive your invite) 
    Monday, November 17, 5:30–6:30 PM 
  • Tuesday, November 18, 5:30–6:30 PM 
 
Learn more about the study at https://students.wisc.edu/333-east-campus-mall/.  
 
Thanks for helping shape the future of student-centered spaces at UW–Madison! 
If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to me.  
 
 
Argyle Wade 
Associate Vice Chancellor and Chief of Staff for Student Affairs 
argyle.wade@wisc.edu 

333 East Campus Mall, 3rd Floor

Sun-Thurs: 10am-10pm | Fri & Sat: 10am-8pm

soli.wisc.edu | 608.263.0365

Formerly known as the Center for Leadership & Involvement


For a complete list of services & to schedule an appointment, visit About SOLI.

subject: Spring Co-Op Orientation- TOMORROW (11/18)-- 1-2 pm, EH 1610
preview:
Good morning COE Undergrads,

If you have accepted a co-op offer for the Spring semester, please see important details regarding the upcoming Engineering Career Services Spring Co-op Orientation happening tomorrow--

  *
Tuesday, November 18th from 1
body_html:
Good morning COE Undergrads,

If you have accepted a co-op offer for the Spring semester, please see important details regarding the upcoming Engineering Career Services Spring Co-op Orientation happening tomorrow--
  • Tuesday, November 18th from 1:00-2:00 pm in Engineering Hall #1610

Attending an orientation is the first step in getting authorized for the required co-op course.  Attendance is welcomed regardless of whether you have reported your Spring co-op on Handshake or not.  During the orientation session, ECS will cover all aspects of the co-op process from reporting & authorization to course expectations.  Please make sure you attend!  You do not need to register for the session.  The orientation is scheduled as a 60 minute period.


You can find more Co-Op information by utilizing the link to the ECS webpage below:

https://ecs.wisc.edu/students/co-op-and-internship/academic-credit/


Drew Graf

Career Services Advisor

Engineering Career Services

University of Wisconsin-Madison

aagraf@wisc.edu

ecs.wisc.edu

608-262-3356

Schedule an Appointment: https://go.wisc.edu/ecs.appt.graf

subject: Register today for an Ansys webinar!
preview:
Register for upcoming Ansys webinars.
Adjust Email Preferences        View in Browser
Upcoming Ansys Webinars
Harness the full potential of Ansys simulation to achieve your product goals by registering for an upcoming webinar. Choose from the many topi
body_html:
Register for upcoming Ansys webinars.
Adjust Email PreferencesView in Browser

Upcoming Ansys Webinars

Harness the full potential of Ansys simulation to achieve your product goals by registering for an upcoming webinar. Choose from the many topics below or find additional webinars on the Ansys calendar.

If you are not seeing events of interest to you, make sure to change your email preferences. 
 

3D DESIGN

Rapid Design Exploration with Creo Simulation Live and Creo Ansys Simulation
November 19, 2025, at 11 AM EST / 5 PM CET / 9:30 PM IST
Learn how Creo Simulation Live and Creo Ansys Simulation optimize the design-to-validation process, offering quicker insights, minimizing prototype use, and enhancing confidence in design choices.

ELECTRONICS

Ansys HFSS + SynMatrix AI: Low-Loss Planar Filters
November 20, 2025, at 11 AM EST / 5 PM CET / 9:30 PM IST
Planar filters are now essential in RF and microwave systems, offering compact, cost-effective, and high-frequency solutions compatible with PCB technology.

Prevent Electric Breakdown in High Voltage Systems with Ansys Maxwell
December 9, 2025, at 10 AM EST / 4 PM CET / 8:30 PM IST
Ansys Maxwell helps prevent breakdown in high voltage systems with tools for inception voltage evaluation, accurate simulations, and visualizations to ensure robust designs against arcing.

EMBEDDED SOFTWARE

Mastering EN 50716: Building Certified Railway Software with Ansys SCADE
December 11, 2025, at 10 AM EST / 4 PM CET / 8:30 PM IST
See how model-based design and automated code generation ensure compliance with safety standards.

FLUIDS

CFD Simulation for Mixing Vessels: Faster with the New Ansys App
November 20, 2025, at 10 AM EST / 4 PM CET / 8:30 PM IST
The Ansys CFD Mixing App enables faster and easier flow and mixing calculations. Join to understand the capabilities and usability of the new Ansys App.

OPTICS

A Comprehensive Introduction to the Simulation Ecosystem for Photonic ICs
November 20, 2025, at 12:30 AM EST / 6:30 AM CET / 11 AM IST
Photonic Integrated Circuits (PICs) design uses a comprehensive simulation framework for device optimization, circuit simulation, and system validation across various applications, including LiDAR and quantum photonics.

Ansys Optics Virtual Deep Dive: Accelerate Photonics with Ansys Cloud Burst Compute
November 20, 2025, at 11:30 AM EST / 5:30 PM CET / 10 PM IST
Learn how Ansys Cloud Burst Compute integrates directly with Lumerical to deliver faster turnaround times, flexible compute choices, and a seamless path from job submission to results.

OPTIMIZATION

AI Training Data Generation, Management, and Reuse with SPDM, PIDO, and HPC
December 2, 2025, at 11 AM EST / 5 PM CET / 9:30 PM IST
Discover how to use Ansys optiSLang and Ansys Minerva for AI Training Data Generation, management, and Reuse with SPDM, PIDO, and HPC.

Democratizing Simulation and AI-Powered Apps for SPDM and PIDO
December 11, 2025, at 11 AM EST / 5 PM CET / 9:30 PM IST
Learn even more tips and tricks on using Ansys optiSLang and Minerva foron AI Training Data Generation, Management, and Reuse with SPDM, PIDO, and HPC.

STRUCTURES

Closing the Process Chain with Envyo
December 2, 2025, at 11 AM EST / 5 PM CET / 9:30 PM IST
Envyo automates data transfer and material assignment in LS-DYNA projects, simplifying simulation workflows. Learn how it improves consistency and speeds up results.

From Concept to Reality: Robotic Simulation with Ansys Structural Tools
December 9, 2025, at 11 AM EST / 5 PM CET / 9:30 PM IST
Structural simulation is crucial in designing modern robots, ensuring they are functional, safe, and durable. Ansys provides tools for comprehensive system-level modeling of robotic components.

AEROSPACE & DEFENSE

Engineering Resilient Space Systems: Electronic Reliability
November 18, 2025, at 11 AM EST / 5 PM CET / 9:30 PM IST
Ansys Sherlock enhances reliability predictions for space electronics, providing insights into PCB and component-level risk analysis for mission success.

Detecting Threat Signatures
November 19, 2025, at 2 PM EST / 8 PM CET / 12:30 AM IST (+1 day)
Learn how to use physics-based solver numerics including computational fluid dynamics, electromagnetics, and ray tracing to accurately determine a vehicle’s infra-red and radar cross section signatures. (U.S. persons only)

A&D Autonomy - Digital Engineering for Advanced Air Mobility
November 25, 2025, at 10 AM EST / 4 PM CET / 8:30 PM IST
Explore how autonomy, MBSE, and simulation are transforming Advanced Air Mobility and accelerating eVTOL development with digital validation and synthetic data.

Software Reliability for Space: A Model-Based Approach with SCADE and STK
November 25, 2025, at 11 AM EST / 5 PM CET / 9:30 PM IST
Learn how to use Ansys SCADE for model-based development, automated code generation, and verification, featuring a live Satellite Attitude Controller case.

Tracking Layer Sensor Simulation - EOIR and Radar
December 3, 2025, at 2 PM EST / 8 PM CET / 12:30 AM IST (+1 day)
Evaluate sensors against multiple criteria including time to detection and performance. Learn about simulating sensor outputs and generating synthetic scenes to train operators and AI algorithms. (U.S. persons only)

MULTIPHYSICS

Advanced Optimization Techniques for Electric Machine Design
November 25, 2025, at 9 AM EST / 3 PM CET / 7:30 PM IST
Explore how you can leverage Ansys optiSLang and Ansys Motor-CAD integration for efficient design exploration and performance improvement.

STUDENTS

Getting Started with Thermal Analysis in Ansys Mechanical
December 5, 2025, at 11 AM EST / 5 PM CET / 9:30 PM IST
Discover how engineers use thermal analysis to improve performance and reliability — join this Foundational Fridays webinar for an introduction to heat transfer simulation and its real-world application.
 
This email was sent by: ANSYS, Inc.
2600 Ansys Drive, Canonsburg, PA 15317, USA
Email sent to eliu59@wisc.edu

subject: Spring 2026 Student Organization Fair Table Request Form is Open!
preview:
Hello,

You are receiving this email as a primary contact for a registered student organization. We are excited to announce that table signups for the Spring 2026 Student Organization Fair are open!

To sign up, please fill out the table request form
body_html:
Hello,

You are receiving this email as a primary contact for a registered student organization. We are excited to announce that table signups for the Spring 2026 Student Organization Fair are open!

To sign up, please fill out the table request form in WIN. Please note that space in the Kohl Center is limited, and signups will be accepted on a first come, first served basis.  Only the organization’s primary contact will be able to access this form.

In order to sign up for a table, your organization must be active and not have violated policy at previous org fairs. Organizations that are ineligible to request a table due to previous policy violations have been sent a reminder email.

The Spring 2026 Student Organization Fair will be Tuesday, February 10 at the Kohl Center. The deadline for canceling your table without penalty is January 27 at 5:00 pm CST. 

More information about tabling policies can be found on the SOLI website: https://soli.wisc.edu/rso-info-for-student-organization-fair/

If you have any questions or concerns, please email rsoevents@union.wisc.edu. 

We look forward to seeing your organization at the Spring 2026 Student Org Fair!

Best,

Student Organization Fair Planning Team

Student Organization Fair Planning Team

333 East Campus Mall, 3rd Floor

soli.wisc.edu | rsoevents@union.wisc.edu


You are receiving this email because you are a member of Wisconsin Involvement Network (WIN).

Cancel your table for the Spring 2026 Student Organization Fair without penalty

subject: RSO Accreditation Update
preview:
Hello,

I am reaching out with an update on your RSO’s Accredited status, because you are one of the members who is part of your RSO’s Canvas group in the RSO Accreditation Course.

Unfortunately, your organization did not meet the requirements for RS
body_html:
Hello,

I am reaching out with an update on your RSO’s Accredited status, because you are one of the members who is part of your RSO’s Canvas group in the RSO Accreditation Course.

Unfortunately, your organization did not meet the requirements for RSO Accreditation for the 2025-2026 academic year.  

That being said, I wanted to provide the reminder that RSO Accreditation is completely optional, and not achieving it has no effect on your RSO’s status as a registered student org, space in the Student Activity Center (if relevant), and access to other benefits provided to all RSOs at UW-Madison. There is no penalty for not meeting the requirements, and your RSO is welcome to pursue Accreditation next academic year if you so wish.

Next week, I will be removing the RSOs and members who did not meet Accreditation requirements from the RSO Accreditation Canvas course so that you do not have to receive unnecessary announcements or notifications. If you wish to do so yourself sooner than that, please go to the homepage of the course and click “Drop this course” on the right side of the page.

I want to thank you for your organization’s efforts and interest in the RSO Accreditation Program. As you may know, this is the Office for Student Organizations, Leadership & Involvement’s first year instituting the program, and we greatly appreciate the time you put into the program, no matter how many requirements you achieved.

Please feel free to reach out to me at this email if you have any questions or concerns. Have a great week!

Best,

Sarah Volk, M.S. (she/her)

Graduate Advisor

Office for Student Organizations, Leadership & Involvement

University of Wisconsin, Madison

todos.content: Drop the RSO Accreditation Canvas course by going to the homepage and clicking 'Drop this course'

subject: NNN: Nifty November News
preview:
NNN: Nifty November News

Happy half way through November! We’ve got some exciting stuff coming up, so make sure you read through all of the email. A reminder that if you are coming on training trip, you MUST be driver authorized.


Volunteer Coach U
body_html:
NNN: Nifty November News

Happy half way through November! We’ve got some exciting stuff coming up, so make sure you read through all of the email. A reminder that if you are coming on training trip, you MUST be driver authorized. 


Volunteer Coach Update: 

We are excited to announce that Connor Oats will be joining us as a volunteer coach to help out Bill, but don’t fret, Jess will still be helping the team occasionally as well! Thank you all for your feedback!


Important notes:

  • FORMAL FORM is OUT!!! (See Alice’s section for more!)

  • Upcoming Swimathon!!! (See Jonathan’s section for more) 

  • Get driver authorized on DSE! (This will be a requirement to go on training trip, so start the process now)

    • Steps to do that can be found here

  • Mark your Calendar for Nationals!!!!! (See Mason’s section)


This week’s happenings:

  • Basketball Game Fundraising (Monday & Saturday!)

  • Swimathon on Wednesday!!

  • Friendsgiving (Friday, 6 PM)!


‘Til next week

Your fav Co-prez’s✌️



Practice News - Emma Holsen 

Wednesday’s swim practice will include the swimathon! Check out Jonathan’s section for more information. 


Reminder: Run practice has been moved to 4:30 PM. There are no more outdoor bike practices for the semester. Instead, we will be offering two indoor bike options on Thursdays. We have the normal spot from 7-8:30pm and a new spot from 8:30-10pm. 

 


Strava of the Week!

Wow 🥛🐄



Race (MWCTC) - Mason Reitmeier

See the updated Winter Racing Schedule here! 

This includes a Feb 1st race hosted by Mizzou Tri that wasn’t in the calendar originally: 


Also, 

Nationals has been confirmed for the dates of March 27th and 28th in Mississippi! Exciting!! 


See this Clash Endurance link: https://clashendurance.com/pages/usatccnc for all the information we have at this time! 

 

How do I qualify? In order to race at Nationals, you have to qualify by racing either at Maple Grove this past August or by starting (not necessarily finishing!) any MWCTC USA Triathlon sanctioned  race this winter! Ask if you have questions!


 Have any ideas or other questions? Let me know at (+1 (612) 500 8869) or email (witri.race@gmail.com)


That’s all I’ve got for now! 


Social - Alice Hegeman


It was great to see so many of you at Mickie’s yesterday!! We’ve got a few more big opportunities for socials coming up, so buckle up:


The FIRST EVER Witri Friendsgiving will be on Friday, Nov. 21st, at 6pm. Katie and Abbey have graciously offered to host at their house (427 W Dayton) so we’re going to provide the food. Sign up here! 🍁🦃🍗


Our Fall Formal will be on Dec. 6th at Lucky’s 13thirteen event space. 🕺🪩🥳 Please fill out this form to let us know if you’ll be there (and if you’ll be bringing a plus one)!


The security deposit for Training Trip is due TONIGHT. Final reminder!! I’ll have to remove you from planning if you do not pay this or communicate to me/Bennett about paying this.


If you’d like to go to practice with the Gymnastics Club on any of the coming Tuesday nights, sign up here🤸🎉



Fundraising - Jonathan Buscher

Hi everyone,


Big thing for this week: On Wednesday, 11/19, during swim practice, we will have a swim-a-thon to raise money for Nationals! Everyone who wants to participate will get 30 minutes to swim as far as they can/want and can ask family/friends to pledge a little money per lab. If you can’t swim for 30 minutes straight yet, no worries, just swim as many laps as you can/want. You can start asking your friends and family for pledges and donations now, as described in the spreadsheet! You can track any pledges of donations by making a copy of this spreadsheet. 

Also, we have a few more spots open for the Football game vs. Illinois this Saturday, and signups (and also the cutoff for canceling) will be this Wednesday. This will be a longer fundraising event but will be a ton of fun and be a huge opportunity for the team!


We are pretty much full on basketball games for this semester, but signups for games next semester will open soon (You can look at the fundraising doc if you’re interested in which games we will be doing!). As always, Everyone who fundraises (at basketball games) has to have the forms (linked on the front page of the spreadsheet) completed before working an event. Even if you filled out forms/did servsafe last year, there is still a form and an easy 15 minute training that need to be filled out, listed in the instruction document found on the first page of the signup spreadsheet. If you are signed up already and cannot make it, you must inform me no fewer than 5 days before the event; otherwise, you need to find a replacement with complete forms. Message me if you have any questions either over snap or at witri.fundraising@gmail.com. 


If you completed the ServSafe certification this year and want to get reimbursed, if you haven’t done so already please forward me the invoice from the training. 



As always, feel free to put any fundraising suggestions in the form here. 


Treasurer - Bennett Hogeland

Happy Sunday! It’s awesome that we got some nice weather yesterday as a last hurrah before winter.  For those of you attending Training Trip, make sure to venmo @witri $150 for the deposit. Feel free to reach out with any questions!


Membership dues for the full year are $100, or you can pay $70 for just a semester. Our Venmo is @witri. PLEASE make sure to include your first/last name and wisc email in the Venmo message. Year-long dues and spring-semester dues cover the summer as well. If you have any questions about paying dues, please reach out to me (Bennett) at (920)-445-4790  or witri.treasurer@gmail.com.  As always, if dues prohibit you/any prospective member from joining the team, please inform any board member! We never want financial circumstances to prevent someone from joining the triathlon team.


Lastly: the team sometimes reimburses members for expenses (ex: gas payments for driving to a race; you’ll know if you’re getting reimbursed). Going forward, it is REQUIRED that you get a physical receipt if you want to be reimbursed (you can give me the physical receipt or send a photo of the receipt). If there is no possible way to get a physical receipt, get the best possible alternative. Screenshots of bank statements won’t cut it. If you have any questions feel free to reach out to me and ask. 



Volunteering - Sam Kuemmel


Massive shoutout to everyone who came out to volunteer at MM I love you all. The Women’s Lax team is doing a food drive this week - if you have any non perishables I will be at swim practice this Monday (right at the Nick entrance) to collect any team donations! As always, you can view your volunteer hours (which subsidize your 2026 nats cost) here.


Media - Nathan Stewart

Before we get to the cold case, I am making a photo slideshow for Formal. Please feel free to upload any photos you have taken this semester!

Album

“Nathan Solves Cold Cases” - Dyatlov Pass

The Dyatlov Pass Incident was an event in which nine hikers from the Soviet Union’s Ural Polytechnical Institute were found deceased in a northern area of the Ural Mountains while on a several week long trekking trip in January 1959. Poor weather conditions resulted in the group losing their bearings as it was getting late. They decided to stop on the side of the mountain and pitch their tent with a plan to reorient themselves at sunrise the next morning.

Overnight something had caused them to cut their way out of their tents from the inside, none of the hikers was dressed well enough for the roughly -30F temperatures. Six of the nine hikers died due to hypothermia, but the remaining three died from physical trauma. Some of the victims injuries included soft tissue damage to the head and face, two the victims had missing eyes, one was  missing a tongue. The extent of the injuries was cause for much speculation as the cause behind the hikers deaths, with theories including animal attacks, an avalanche or loud slab avalanche to their tent, appearance of a UFO or ball lightning, infrasound-induced panic, conflict with local ethnic groups or fugitive criminals, military rocket- and nuclear-testing involvement, or some combination of these factors.

The official explanation of the incident had been determined to be an avalanche. The sound of an incoming avalanche caused them all to get up and leave their tent as soon as possible, they cut their way out and ran towards the trees for safety. Once the danger had passed they attempted to make their way back to their tent, but it was too dark and too cold. Some continued to try and find their way back, some stayed and made a fire, some left for the creek

Even though this is the official theory, there are plenty of reasons as to why I believe it holds little weight. The area they were camped in showed no evidence of an avalanche, in the 100s of expeditions since no one has experienced an avalanche there, and the amount of experience among the group should have prevented them from camping in an avalanche area.

My personal favorite theory is a psychological break, specifically paradoxical undressing. This is a psychological symptom of hypothermia where the victim feels like they are over heating, even burning. This would explain the lack of proper clothing. More severe effects of hypothermia could have resulted in visual or auditory hallucinations, which may explain the severity of the injuries. 


Next week D.B. Cooper?


Link to all Google Photos albums

Instagram @wisconsintriathlon

Tik Tok @Wisconsintriathlon


Apparel - Sam Mc Gown


Hey Everyone! All non-race gear has arrived, (race gear set to arrive post-ThanksGiving). If you still have not picked up your gear please contact me.


And as always, we have a Redbubble site! You can order some AWESOME Wisconsin Triathlon stickers whenever you would like! There is no deadline to order and the stickers will ship directly to you! 

Use this link to get to our storefront: Click Here

What has 2 butts and kills people?

An assassin

As always, the list of current sponsors is attached below. :)

2025-2026 Sponsors

  • Performance/Racing Tips

  • – Join the Wisconsin Triathlon Google Calendar here! You can add the GCal to your own personal Google Calendar for easy access. 


YOU MUST BE REGISTERED ON DO SPORTS EASY TO BE ON THE TEAM! Follow this link to get registered! 





Fun fact of the day:

Cows have best friends. Studies show they get stressed when separated from them. 🐄


Keep crushing it!

subject: The Baja Weekly
preview:
Good People of Baja Racing,

Hopefully everyone had a relaxing weekend and that school is going well for all you smart cookies!


This weekend was CADpocalypse, and I know a lot of great work got done! Thank you to everyone who dedicated a chunk of t
body_html:
Good People of Baja Racing,

Hopefully everyone had a relaxing weekend and that school is going well for all you smart cookies! 


This weekend was CADpocalypse, and I know a lot of great work got done! Thank you to everyone who dedicated a chunk of their weekend to fleshing out designs and giving freshmen new haircuts. This week, we will have meetings on Tuesday, November 18th, at 6pm in ECB 1003 Tong and Thursday, November 20th, at 6:30pm. Rooms for Thursday will be posted in slack.


We’ll be working on CAD and FEA, so talk with your team lead if you need help on your project. Let’s use this week to design a lighter, faster, better car! 


Feeling left out of all the Baja fun? Get your machining upgrades: https://making.engr.wisc.edu/equipment/

Lileigh Nguyen

University of Wisconsin-Madison

Mechanical Engineering 

Baja SAE Co-President


E:   lpnguyen6@wisc.edu

C:   (507) 686-0353


“The fish do not care how many horsepower your boat has”- Henry

subject: Apply Now - One Week Left to GO WASB! Applications are due on November 23.
preview:
Learn more about the app and the org online or at any of our upcoming events!


Applications for Spring 2026 Membership Due: Nov. 23 @ 11:59 pm
Hey Badgers!

Just a quick reminder that there is only ONE WEEK LEFT to get your application to join WASB
body_html:
Learn more about the app and the org online or at any of our upcoming events!
Applications for Spring 2026 Membership Due: Nov. 23 @ 11:59 pm
Hey Badgers!

Just a quick reminder that there is only ONE WEEK LEFT to get your application to join WASB submitted! Applications are due by Sunday, November 23 at 11:59 pm; you can find the link to it, along with more information and FAQs on our Apply Now page on our website. 

A quick reminder of who we are: We are an enthusiastic and spirited group of Badgers who are committed to creating positive and impactful experiences for Badgers past, present, and future! As a student org sponsored by the Wisconsin Alumni Association (WAA), we serve as ambassadors to the WAA and the university at large. As a WASB Member, you will have the opportunity to delve into your interests and become a part of our welcoming community of 65 students, all while gaining invaluable leadership and professional skills. When current members are asked, “Why WASB?” their responses repeatedly highlight the inclusive and supportive community, connections made, and skills and experiences gained along the way. 

You can also learn more about us by visiting our general website and following us on Instagram! We hope to hear from you soon!

-The Wisconsin Alumni Student Board
Copyright © 2025, Wisconsin Alumni Student Board, All rights reserved.

Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can update your preferences or unsubscribe from this list

todos.content: Submit application to join WASB for Spring 2026 Membership

Join QTE for our annual pie-centered club meeting! Meet with other QTE members and enjoy fall-themed pies and games.
Upcoming Events & Other Opportunities
We're hiring PEER ADVISORS in ECS!
Application deadline - November 23rd.

Engineering Career Services is looking for current Badger Engineer undergrads to join our inaugural cohort of ECS Peer Advisors this Spring 2026 semester!  As an Engr. Career Peer, you will assist fellow Badger Engineers with resume reviews during drop-in advising hours, prep for internships/co-ops, and how to use Handshake & LinkedIn. You will also get to support a wide variety of ECS programming. If you are interested in learning more, click here or email questions to ecs@engr.wisc.edu. Application deadline - November 23rd.
Drop-In Advising Begins

All College of Engineering Academic advisors will be meeting with students through a drop-in advising format through November 20. Check your @wisc.edu email for a message from your advisor about their schedule.

Look for This Week in CoE in your inbox each week for upcoming events, updates from the college, and ways to get involved and connected in CoE.

subject: Seeking Help with Ed Pol 320 Project Survey
preview:
Hi Badgers!

I am working on a project for Ed Pol 320 on human nature connection amongst college students at UW-Madison. As part of this, I am collecting data from individuals in the student body on how much time they spend in nature and how connected t
body_html:
Hi Badgers!

I am working on a project for Ed Pol 320 on human nature connection amongst college students at UW-Madison. As part of this, I am collecting data from individuals in the student body on how much time they spend in nature and how connected they feel to the nature on campus. This data will help me develop potential opportunities to increase nature on campus. 

If you have 5-10 minute, please fill out the survey linked in this email. Thank you for your help! 

Ed Pol 320 Project Survey

Thank you again, 
Chase Boles

subject: Don't Miss Out | Student Policy Conference
preview:
Hi Badgers!


Interested in policy? This is for you! The Wisconsin Ideas Conference – UW's only student policy conference – is celebrating its 10th year, and we'd love for you to be part of it!


This is the perfect way to build skills, meet peers,
body_html:
Hi Badgers!


Interested in policy? This is for you! The Wisconsin Ideas Conference – UW's only student policy conference – is celebrating its 10th year, and we'd love for you to be part of it!


This is the perfect way to build skills, meet peers, and gain professional experience. No prior experience needed; just bring an idea you care about.


What you'll gain:

     •  Build confidence by creating your own policy memo (with plenty of support!)

     •  Get your analysis published

     •  Join a community of students passionate about change

     •  Make connections with faculty and alumni



Apply here: https://forms.gle/pKzXneWtGx4SB6n69.

Curious what past conferences looked like? Check out 2024’s proceedings at the library or online (2025’s will soon be at the library too)!


If you have questions, please reach out to me at kblumenfeld@wisc.edu.


We hope to see your ideas come to life this spring!


Kate Blumenfeld

Wisconsin Ideas Conference

Instagram: @ideas_conference - follow to stay up to date!

todos.content: Apply for the Wisconsin Ideas Conference
Reach out to Kate Blumenfeld at kblumenfeld@wisc.edu with questions
Follow @ideas_conference on Instagram to stay up to date

events.title: Wisconsin Ideas Conference
events.content: UW's only student policy conference, celebrating its 10th year. It's an opportunity to build skills, meet peers, gain professional experience, create a policy memo, get analysis published, join a community of students passionate about change, and make connections with faculty and alumni.

subject: Resolving Enrollment Holds
preview:
This email provides more information about resolving enrollment holds:

RESOLVING ENROLLMENT HOLDS
To be able to enroll on your assigned date/time, you need to resolve all holds on your account.

Financial Responsibility Agreement Hold
Each semester
body_html:
This email provides more information about resolving enrollment holds:

 

RESOLVING ENROLLMENT HOLDS

To be able to enroll on your assigned date/time, you need to resolve all holds on your account. 

 

Financial Responsibility Agreement Hold

Each semester, every student must complete the Pre-Enrollment Checklist to remove your financial responsibility agreement hold.  The checklist is found in the MyUW Portal > Student Center > Tasks.  It takes only 5-10 minutes to complete.

  

Tuition Balance Past Due Hold

If you see this hold, please contact the Bursar’s Office to resolve outstanding tuition or library fees.  Their contact information is found at the bottom of this website:  https://bursar.wisc.edu/about

 

                Faculty Advising Hold

Some majors require students to meet with their faculty advisor each semester or once per year before enrollment. You can find your faculty advisor’s name in Starfish.  Please send them an email with your course plan and availability to meet, or if offered, book an appointment with them using Starfish. 

 

                Co-op Hold

                If you are on co-op during fall semester, please note that the co-op hold will not impact your ability to enroll in Spring 2026 courses.  No action is required. 

 

I hope this information is helpful.

Susan

 

Susan Pommer (she/her) | Book appointment

Academic Advisor

College of Engineering

University of Wisconsin-Madison

Wendt Commons – First Floor (Lower level / floor below Design Innovation Lab)

(608) 890-4160

 

Have an urgent mental health concern?

UW-Madison 24-hour crisis services: 608-265-5600 (select option 9 for crisis services)

Concerned about a student?

Click here to fill out a student of concern report

 

Please note that email is not checked outside of business hours or on weekends. If you are experiencing a crisis, please contact our 24-hour crisis services, dial 911, or go to your nearest emergency room.

todos.content: Resolve all holds on your account to be able to enroll on your assigned date/time.
Complete the Pre-Enrollment Checklist (found in MyUW Portal > Student Center > Tasks) to remove your financial responsibility agreement hold.
Contact the Bursar’s Office to resolve outstanding tuition or library fees (contact information at https://bursar.wisc.edu/about).
Send your faculty advisor (found in Starfish) an email with your course plan and availability to meet.
Book an appointment with your faculty advisor (found in Starfish) using Starfish, if offered.

PEER ADVISING

  *   Student Pe
body_html:
Hello!

 

RESOLVING ENROLLMENT HOLDS

To be able to enroll on your assigned date/time, you need to resolve all holds on your account.  Please see my other email titled “Resolving Enrollment Holds” for more information.  

 

PEER ADVISING

  • Student Peer Advisors are available to help with enrollment!  Here is their schedule: LINK
  • They should be your first contact for help using Course Search & Enroll (CS&E) – generating schedule options, enrollment, and/or joining waitlists.  

 

FINAL FALL SEMESTER DROP DEADLINE

  • A reminder that the last day to drop a course or withdraw from this semester is Monday, November 24.
  • If you are a first-year student considering dropping a course, please attend drop-in advising so we can discuss options and the impact on progression.  

 

ACADEMIC ADVISING

  • During November, academic advising uses a Drop-In Advising format. This means you can just show up – no appointment is required!
  • Drop-in meetings are typically 10-15 minutes and are focused on questions about spring course selection or to discuss study supports or dropping a fall course.   
  • Drop-in advising hours are hosted in the academic advising office and on Zoom as noted in the table below. 
  • You may need to wait in a queue of students, so please bring some work or reading.  Room 140 is available as a study room while you wait.  
  • I have time set aside for urgent personal situations.  If you need this support, please email me and we will schedule an appointment as soon as possible
  • Appointments will be available again in Starfish until December.  

 

MY DROP-IN SCHEDULE FOR NOVEMBER 17 – 21st 

This drop-in schedule can also be found in Starfish.

If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to reach out to me.  

 

On Wisconsin!

Susan 

 

Susan Pommer (she/her) | Book appointment

Academic Advisor

(608) 890-4160

 

Have an urgent mental health concern?

Concerned about a student?

Click here to fill out a student of concern report

 

Please note that email is not checked outside of business hours or on weekends. If you are experiencing a crisis, please contact our 24-hour crisis services, dial 911, or go to your nearest emergency room.

subject: Humanoid Robotics Club Outreach––First General Meeting
preview:
Hi CS Advising,
This is Evan! I’m reaching out regarding the first meeting of this newly founded humanoid robotics club. Could you help me include this outreach message in the next weekly newsletter?

Thank you so much!

–––———————————————————————
J
body_html:
Hi CS Advising,
This is Evan! I’m reaching out regarding the first meeting of this newly founded humanoid robotics club. Could you help me include this outreach message in the next weekly newsletter?

Thank you so much!

–––———————————————————————
Join the FIRST EVER Humanoid Robotics club in UW-Madison!

We will be building a full humanoid robot with dexterous hands, custom actuators, and general-purpose intelligence through VLA (Vision Language Action) models. Our first interest meeting will be on December 2, 6:00-7:00 PM, Room 1610 Engineering Hall, and soon after that we’ll start to design our first prototype.

This is the team people will wish they joined a year from now, and we’re just starting, so you get to participate from the start, in this grand undertaking of building a Humanoid Robot from scratch! Do not miss out this opportunity. Tell your friends and everyone you know!


Join our Discord: https://discord.gg/u6P5wu8ywc 
Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/wiscohumanoids
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wiscohumanoids/

Watch Teaser: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aw7vV4zyR4M 
Check Out Our Website: https://www.wiscohumanoids.com/

todos.content: Include the Humanoid Robotics Club outreach message in the next weekly newsletter.
